Ueno Park, one of the first parks in Tokyo, is so large, so well-known, and so populated with cherry trees (more than 800) that we were sure there would be some cherry trees full of blossoms on March 28th even though blooming was late in 2016. The park is free and easily accessible, next to the Ueno subway station. There were large crowds, especially around the few trees that were blooming. The few blooming trees attracted constant attention, and we felt that one tree was particularly attractive. We enjoyed the view of the lake from the top of the hill and browsing the food stalls near the lake. We went only for the cherry blossoms, so we did not visit museums or other places of interest. But we felt content that we had seen one of the most written-about and talked-about places in Tokyo.
Had a great stroll. spent few hours here with friends, clean park. If you want to know more just go to museum. It will be nice if the come in the cherry blossom time..

So many experiences. Ueno Park is a wonderful place to visit. It shows off so much of Japan: the zoo, the shrines, the plants, the pond, the atmosphere, the weekend action, the nearby street markets. Must see for Tokyo

A stroll in the park. Visited on a Sunday when the Tokyo Dance Festival was on. What a superb place. So many little features, shrines and fountains set amongst large museums and buildings all within a sprawling park. You can discover your own niche. Be it a museum or a small temple or just a quiet corner away from it all. Very relaxing and enjoyable.
Very crowded sometimes. Nice park with temples and other attractions like zoo and likes. During great weather and weekend the place is very crowded.

Beautiful day in the park. Busy with people on a hot spring day.Lovely space, so much to see. Full of museums, large lanterns, beautiful trees.Worth visiting the Peony Garden (fee charged) in the Spring.

Big garden but not crowed people. It is a great park in tokyo with a lot if sakura (japnese symbols tree). It also easy to take the train to go there, and easy to go some near place from there like yanaka, akihabara, ueno zoo. It is free ticket, you can watch some free streer performance in the park, i recommend you come here on the last of march, begin of April when the sakura blossom.

Big and nice park to chill. Too bad I arrived at this park quite late in the evening. The weather is good to chill but the sky is dark to take more pictures. Very Big park, I hope I have arranged more time to chill at this park. Along the way to the park, have many food shops/drug stores..No worries.

Gorgeous park with a ton of fun stuff to do. We visited during cherry blossom season, so it was probably more festive than usual, but still...there was so much fun stuff to do! Great museums, large and small, sweeping vistas, wide open spaces. Very accessible via public transportation (right on the Tamanote subway line).

great park and huge to chill and explore !. Convenient to access via station just next, great park, huge to explore, also great to meet students as university within it, been there at each of my visits in Japan/Tokyo.

Very nice. We walked through the park to get to Ueno Zoo. We went during the end of cherry blossom season and it was still enjoyable. Many people still picnic in the park and the weather was good enough for just a sweater and pants. We didn't go near the water area but from afar it looked serene. I enjoyed walking around and it seems to be the place to picnic.

Ueno Day. This place is beautiful especially when Sakura blooms. But I guess, we went there during the peak season, It was really crowded. But nevertheless ir's a beautiful place for "Tambay2x", chill2x and relaxation

Magnificent Cherry Blossoms. We arrived in Tokyo on April 5th and after dropping our luggage off we headed for Ueno Park. It was probably around 4 ish when we arrived and people were already setting up blankets/tarpaulins for evening picnics. It was stunningly beautiful. So many trees in full blossom. As the light faded the red lanterns floating high along the paths began to glow. It was magical. Wander the paths, explore the many temples and museums in the grounds. There are food stalls where you can discover all sorts of things. Allow a couple of hours at least but more if you want to see the museums.

Very crowded during sakura season. One of the most famous sakura (cherry blossom) viewing spot. So famous that it is guaranteed to be teeming with both tourists and locals during peak season. Nevertheless, Ueno park won't disappoint you.

Love this park!. This is probably one of the highlights in my trip to Tokyo. The park is beautiful and ideal for a stroll. Plus, I love how the cherry blossoms adorned the walking path! Such a romantic scene!

Large pretty park. We enjoyed our visit on a weekend when a lot of activity and food stalls ... . Lake not particularly scenic, but the park is very convenient being accessed directly from Ueno Station. Brilliant in cherry blossom season.

A fine stroll in the park. Didn't care much about cherry blossoms, just came here for the vibe of locals. On the main walk there is some area for picnic (actually just a place to drink and eat). In the evening, lots of people got drunk and was singing and shouting and behaving, well, just drunk :) but this is also a part of the local culture so I was glad to experience that. Apart from that, it is just a mid-size park surrounded by large concrete jungle. And yes, the shrines also, and a beautiful pond. Even some people selling used stuff like on a flea market. Too bad we flew half the world, otherwise we would have bought something.
slow down. Lovely park with lots of things to do and see. It's just so relaxing to take a walk through the park during your stay in hectic Tokyo.

Visit during Cherry(sakura) Blossom time. A must! Easy to get there on the subway--drops off across the street. Stroll under the pink and white canopy, visit a shrine or museum, get an ice cream or make a picnic with local street vendor grilled goodies. Get some good photos!

Good for a nice long walk.... Located right next to Ueno Zoo and Tokyo National Museum, this park features lots of areas to walk, relax or have lunch. There's a cafe and a Starbucks and while I was there some locals were performing a dance routine. A nice spot to visit if you're heading to the neary zoo or museum.
park to remember. beautiful park in Ueno if you want to get away from it all and relax for a moment is this busy city that never sleeps

Very crowded during cherry blossom!. It should be noticed that it was extremely crowded during cherry blossom, especially night illumination. I don't recommend solo-travallers to visit this place during this busy season. Of course, cherry blossom is so beautiful in the park, but you cannot catch a good photo due to a lot of people. If you really want to visit it, I do suggest you to visit in very early morning. In fact, you really do so, some places in the park do not look really great due to what was left from the last night.

Beautiful cherry blossom . This is a beautiful park for cherry blossom viewing. I went there 24-29th of April, just in the beginning of the cherry tree blossom season! The flowers hadn't truly blossomed yet but the park was beautiful and full of people and I'm sure during the full blossom it's magical here!It's a nice place for picnic or to buy local food from the food stands, you can see local people as well as tourists relaxing on blankets around the lake. I recommend this park for people of all ages. It's easy to access through to metro!
Convenient public transport, good location and amenities. There are museums, restaurants, shopping malls around the area and not overcrowded on a sunny Saturday morning. I couldn't ask for more.

A fun Outing, and A Must-Visit. Ueno Park is located to the north east of Tokyo, main access via the Ueno Station. There are temples, museums, Ueno zoos (east and west) for the Giant Panda Attraction, and the famous Tokyo Bunka Kaikan. Be prepared to spend a whole day in the park. Suggest you go as early as possible or else the crowd will start flooding in after 11am everyday, especially on weekends. Consider carefully which Museum you wish to visit if you have limited time. Also, check out the Tokyo Bunka Kaitan Recital Hall on the weekends matinees. Definitely worth a visit if there are any performances. A Must-Visit when in Tokyo.

Peace and tranquility . In my opinion, The best time to visit Ueno will be during the Sakura period. but saying that still it's a very beautiful park, very well maintained. The Ueno Zoo is just next to it and there are many things you can do while you in the park. Park entry is free. You need to take train to JR Ueno and the entrance is right opposite of the exit. The park can be busy during Hanami, But I feel that's the best time to visit. If you have some spare time and need some you time, definitely a great place to visit.

BEAUTIFUL BUT RAINY. We went a few weeks before cherry blossoms bloomed. i could see how gorgeous it would have been. the park itself was amazing, but on the day we went it was cold and rainy. definitely somewhere id like to go back.
Cherry blossom. Arrived early evening at the start of April at the perfect time when all the trees were in bloom. A wonderful place to go as everybody are happy and enjoying there picnics.

Early Cherry Blossom and Pic-Nic / Ueno Park Area. A total Spring experience in Ueno Park. Cherry blossom was just starting but it was already crowded! Many groups of friends and families (even more weird groups like Otakus and Cosplayers were here) were enjoying the good weather, with beers, snacks, pizza, sushi and more! Also, there was a very interesting expo of handcrafted articles (earrings, jewelry), free tasting of Japanese Sparkling wine and Live folk music concerts! Totally recommended for every traveler, worth the experience.

Cherry Blossom Street!. Most of us wants to go to Japan because of the Cherry blossoms. In that case, NEVER forget to go to Ueno Park. Its the perfect spot for photo ops while Sakuras are on full bloom!

Beautiful cherry blossoms. We were there just when the cherry blossoms were at their fullest. We could see all the locals having picnics with friends and families, celebrating the beauty of the moment. We felt the peace and harmony that brings the enjoyment of nature's beauty at its best. Not to be missed in this time of the year!
Relaxing. Arrived here just at the start of June. A nice place if you want to spend some quiet time - alone or with someone.

I visited Ueno Park during sakura and it was breathtaking.. I admit that is not breathtaking during the rest of the year, but coming here and seeing the abundance of cherry blossoms when the time is right is amazing.
Was there for Spring. Easy to find and very well organised even though it was full of people looking at the AMAZING cherry trees

Wonderful - sakura at its best!!!. Sakura (Cherry Blossom) was in full bloom when we were there. Our coach driver recommended it and how right he was. Every bit of ground was covered by the Japanese - they put out ground sheets and sat and enjoyed picnics - they consider this time of year very special and they go out of their way to celebrate its arrival. We were so lucky with the weather and the trees were loaded with blossom. Beautiful! And it is next to a main tube line, so easy access.

A walk in a park with a lot of history. This park is a must go place. It's free to enter, you can look at really interesting trees (like the one with a circle-trunk that indicates a beautiful temple) and flowers, everything shining and vivid.This park also has a lot of temples and shrines, a flower garden, many places to take beautiful photos, and even the zoo!Bring you camera, comfortable shoes, water and food if you don't want to walk a lot until find something to buy.
Great Park and Area. Don't miss the north part of it !After our visit we had a great time in one street food place that we strongly recommend !

Beautiful park with a cute amusement park within!. Hoping to catch the remaining sakura and was greeted by only a few trees scattered around the park, however this is a beautiful park to stroll through, have a picnic or just let time stand still.We packed lunch bentos from the food stores (many within the Ueno station, please buy before you exit) with the intention to have a nice lunch under a (sakura) tree in the cool spring weather.As it was a weekday, the park was not overly packed and it was nice to stroll through the spaces.There is also a small amusement area with rides for children, costing before 100-300Yen.

Lovely cherry blossoms. We had an eight hour layover in Tokyo during cherry blossom time. We caught the express train from the airport to Ueno station and found the park easily, directly above the station. There were many people out to see the trees and small parties, but we found the crowds manageable. Many food stalls were set up where we could buy savoury and sweet food and drinks (but they were not cheap). We were too late to see the zoo which was nearby or any of the other attractions in the area (there are quite a few). The lake was beautiful, surrounded by cherry trees in full flower. From Ueno we were able to get the train back to Haneda for our flight, a trip of less than an hour.

Very relaxed area. In researching Tokyo my wife and I both decided we wanted to spend some time in this park and then were lucky enough to find a hotel right across from it. The park itself is planted with a number of cherry and dogwood trees which really look great during their blooms. There are also a number of bulbs planted along the walks and rhododendrons. The park is home to several museums with several others nearby, several Shinto shrines, a 5 story pagoda, zoo, and much more. It is also near restaurants and shopping and several fountains.And it is located directly across from the Ueno Station and safe day or night.

Beautiful park!. Arrived here just at the start of April - just when the cherry blossoms were at their best! What a beautiful park, with a great atmosphere - plenty of tourists and locals enjoying the Sakura. Plenty of things to do nearby - the Zoo, History & Science museum, Tokyo national museum ect. Definitely worth a visit during Sakura season.

Beautiful scenery. Was planning to spend only half a day at this park but spent a full day there instead as there were so many things to do! The street food vendors had loads of local japanese cuisine you can try too!
Superb park during cherry blossom. We visited this park a little bit late at the end of cherry blossom season, but we can imagine the beauty of it during Sakura time.

Very Huge . I came when the sakura was fall. Just one sakura is still blooming. Its suitable for family who want to just relax and talk or picnic. Alot of trees, have starbucks, my kidos like sit in the pool then they playing with the birds around there. For me actually its a little bit boring. We just want to go there to go ueno zoo. But they also have some museum like art and science museum. Recommend for family with babies with stroller who want to be relax and rest
All-in-1!. You can spend a whole day here. There are several museums, and the park itself is nice. We spent an afternoon at the Science Museum and enjoyed the first Sakura blooms.

Trees not fully bloom in late March 2016 but the street food vendors are in full swing!. Not too crowded in late March as the cherry blossom have yet to peak. However enjoyed the grilled seafood and tasty snacks sold by the street vendor near the temple. Just a street across the Euno Station where is left our bags in the locker and toured the park.
Excellent in sunshine. Great for stroll around. Contains the main museums too. Spacious and excellent coverage of trees and cherry blossoms. Recommend this on the way to Yanaka.

Nice, but I'm sure better when the cherry blossoms are blooming. It was a perfectly nice park. We did get to see the last few trees that still had some of its flowers left. Even though the blooms weren't there, it was still lively with many entertainers.

Good place to take a walk. The season of cherry blossoms has ended, but this park is a simbolic place of Ueno because the history of the park dates back to Meiji era. It's very refreshing to take a walk here. It's full of people on weekends but there are some cafe inside the park and there are many museums around the area. This time I found a statue of Hideyo Noguchi inside the park. There is a beautiful fountain and lots of greenary and flowers. Must visit to enjoy the traditional tour of Tokyo.

Beautiful place. I visited this during Spring when the cherry blossoms were blooming, so I really recommend visiting during this time. I'd recommend going early in the day to avoid the huge crowds (although even with the huge crowd it's still a lovely place to visit!). It's quite a large park and I'd definitely recommend visiting it when in Tokyo.
So much to see. Great park for wandering around. There is a lake you can walk around with boats you can paddle on all throughout the day. Near zoo and museums

Great day trip. We spent a good three hours in this park. It was very crowded but everyone was having a good time looking at the cherry blossoms, eating food, and listening to the buskers playing along the walkways - lots to see and do.

"Japan in a nutshell". A park for all ages with year round attractions. Right on the JR commuter train line. Visiting its many museums (including one designed by Le Corbusier) and zoo would take days which I did not have so I strolled through this beautiful park and enjoyed its cherry blossoms just budding in March.Systematized Good Will Guides (tokjyosgg.jp) currently offer free tours three days per week. No reservation, just show up at the Green Salon in Ueno Park on Sunday, Wednesday, Friday at 10:30am or 1:30 pm. This was their current offering; it may change. The tour emphasized history but was designed for the average tourist like myself who just wants to know a bit more. Our guide brought to life a place he called "Japan in a nutshell." It would surely have been of interest to more than just the three of us who showed up. It is also a rare chance to talk to a friendly, fluent English speaking Japanese person about Japanese life in general.

A Walk in The Park. The Ueno Park is located at the Taito district. It is a large public park which is the favorite spot for hanami (cherry blossom viewing) when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom. It has nearby museums and the Ueno Zoo. Walking around the park is quite relaxing. Entrance is free.

So Much To Do. The zoo, museums, temples and an amusement park are only a small part of this park. Throw in some great restaurants and on weekends the noise of buskers and thousands of people enjoying life and it's a must see on Tokyo. An easy train ride in. Oh, not to mention a million shops as you leave the park.

上野公園 - Ueno Park. 上野公園 - Ueno Park 寛永寺、上野東照宮、徳大寺、五重塔、上野動物園、五條天神社、など。The zoo is famous for pandas. I'm not impressed by them. They are idle. The prairie dogs are much better. There is a Thai Sala at the zoo, gifted by the government of Thailand.

We have brunch in the garden. Pretty good place for walking, stay with your family, friends or couple.We bought Bento from supermarket and try to have a seat but unfortunately we forgot to bring out mat (i noticed most Japanese bring mat themselves and then place on the garden and enjoy their meal)

Large park with tatty edges!. There is much to enjoy in Ueno Park especially when the cherries are in bloom however it is a little tired at the edges especially when food vendors occupy the margins at peak flowering time. There are excellent museums around here so it offers a great break out space for relaxation between visits.
Relax and People Watch. I sat on the fountain close to the Tokyo National Museum. A great place to relax, catch your breath, and people watch before going on your next adventure.

Nice park but very touristy. The area is nice and there is a lot to see in the park. But it is really crowded as there are thousands of local and foreign tourists visiting. I was there shortly after the Cherry blossom. Some trees were still in full bloom, most weren't.

Great way to break up the day.. The park is large and although concrete majority the stalls and lake make up for the beauty. There was locals feeding seeds to the birds when my partner and I visited and although we couldn't communicate the man encouraged me to feed the birds too with him. Great experience as I stood with bird feed in my hand and was able have in my hand serval birds at a time. Photos were amazing! There's opportunity to play paddle boats in the lake, for a small fee. The bike style push boats. Very sweet park, great spot for sitting and having lunch.
Beautiful, huge park. Lovely park to stroll through of a crisp spring day, the cherry blossoms weren't quite blooming when I went but I imagine it is even more stunning when they are in full flow.

Beautiful Gardens. The gardens are free to walk around, and a really nice sight to have next to the busy Ueno train station. It is really nice to stop and take in some greenery. It was very busy walk through, particuarly with people trying to get photos with the cherry blossom trees, but this did not distract from how lovely it was. It was great fun to grab a coffee and head here for some people watching, I easily spent an hour say here listening to music and watching the world go by. It was a nice way to relax in the cisty. And the Cosplay photography going on all around was also really interesting to see. The peony gardens were closed when I went which is a shame as it was something I was really looking forward to. But sneaking a look into them, it looked like it would be well worth the visit and admission fee. If you want an escape from the city while being in the city, then this is the perfect location.

After the cherry blossom. It is a very nice park to walk through after a hectic day in Tokyo.Make sure to visit some of the temples and if you go there in mid April there will be lots of flowers out and some of the most beautiful cherrytrees will still be in full bloom.
Much to see. At Ueno Park, there's a lovely temple and Tokyo Zoo also. If you're going to the Museum, give the Park a chance.

A lovely place with lots to do. Ueno Park is an excellent place for people watching, grabbing a snack, and enjoying some greenery. Plus, you can visit the Zoo and several art museums which are also located on the property and there are some great children's play areas - one with a traditional children's playground and one with some "kiddie" rides. My family had a great day there and having the cherry blossoms in bloom just added a little magic to our experience.

Nature and green in metropolitan Tokyo. If you need a break from noisy metropolitan Tokyo, Ueno Park is where you should go and take a short break there. Greens and nature everywhere. Also many fabulous museums near around!!!

Cherry blossom in the park. At the beginning of the evening, when the paper lanterns light up, the cherry flower change from white to pink, peoples have picnic under the trees. If you continue down the stairs to the lake and the temple, along the path, there's lots of small stalls selling all kinds of japanese street food. You would like to taste all of them !
Nice park. Lucky to be there just in time to see the Cherry Blossoms! Place is nice to walk around or relax. One can do picnicking here. Such a serene atmosphere. Love it!

A beatiful place to spend the day!. The stroll through the park was beautiful with all the cherry trees in full bloom. This park has your choice of museums and a zoo. We chose to spend time at the zoo. My husband really enjoyed the animal exhibits. Unfortunately we weren't able to check out the museums because of our time constraints. We are hoping to be able to return explore a couple of these museums.

Breathtaking. We were very lucky to visit this superb garden during the blossomWe were really surprised by sakura the trees are white and the floor covered with falling leaves I never see this nature beauty in my lifeLocals with their families eating talking havinf funTeens wearing fashionable clothes walking aroundVery nice garden huge well maintained Its a must visit

Sakura bloom was just happening. The one week we were in Tokyo, cherry blossom became so prominent in the last days that crowds of people increased by the hour. Yet, everyone proceeded in a civilised manner having due regard for the others.
Beautiful park. Ueno Park is a lovely place, especially when the cherry blossoms are in bloom in spring. It is an expansive sea of green in a city that is badly lacking it.

Perfect place to Picnic under the Sakura Trees!. We went there on a rainy day, however, that did not deter the locals nor tourists from having a picnic under the trees. There were designated areas for members to picnic there! We had a good stroll but did not stay for long due to the rain. Still my son had a good time running about! The flowers were still fully bloomed despite the rain! Do visit the zoo nearby if you have the time!
crowded. Everyone come to this place when Spring break time to see Sakura, so crowded! With all local/overseas tourist (>,<)

Oh the Cherry Blossoms!. I was fortunate enough to visit Ueno park at the height of the cherry blossom season. It was absolutely stunning and something that needs to be seen to be believed. It was very busy with people having picnics but this did not deduct from the experience.

Fascinating place to walk through. The part of the park I visited was mostly around Shinobazu pond. It was cherry blossom season and really busy at the weekend with lots of people sitting on plastic sheeting picnic-ing and enjoying the pretty trees. Never seen so many selfie sticks in action. The park areas with the blossoming trees are lovely, and there were plenty of stalls set up selling unusual cooked foods. Small fish and small octopi on sticks. It's still busy here later in the evening and had a nice atmosphere.

One of many greenspaces in the city.. Came for the cherry blossoms and wasn't disappointed. This park also contains numerous museums, temples and the zoo; however came to early and these attractions were not open yet.

WONDERFUL <3. We went to see the hanami, and we were richly awarded as Japan met us in full bloom everywhere we went. Walking around in Ueno was zen and religion and whatever else there is that will up your senses. Lovely blossoming cherry trees, temples, loads of people and still a very quiet atmosphere. Worth the trip alone.

Cheery blossom. We visited in mid of april. Most of cheery blossom were still there. One of the good choice to see cheery blossom. If you are jogging lover, this place is a good choice for jogging in the morning or evening. Located next to keisei ueno. Very nice to visit and walk around the park with your couple. Or bring wine and snack and then sit and sip wine for relaxing breathing ozone.
Tokyo slows down here. Ueno Park is ideal to escape the hustle and bustle of this mega city. A good place to experience Hanami.

Wonderful Park in the Middle of Tokyo. We've stayed at the Hotel Coco Grand Ueno twice now, and because it is right on Ueno Park, we've gotten to know this wonderful park. In spring the cherry blossoms are amazing and the lotus pond has some of the largest lotus blossoms I've even seen. But even in winter when the trees are bare and the lotus is reduced to golden stalks the park is lovely. There are a couple small shrines on an island in the middle of Shinobazu Pond, and snack vendors set up on weekends. Great place for a stroll in the early evening before you head to nearby Taito for some after-work snacks and sake.

Beautiful!. Went at Beginning of April time during cherry blossoms and its was just the most beautiful thing i've ever seen! would reccomend to anyone :) really lovely park, also had food stalls and boats you could go on :) awesome!

Clouds of Sakura in Springtime. This has got to be one of my favourite places in Tokyo during Sakura season. We were there during the spring festival season last week. My first time seeing a park full of Sakuras and I was not disappointed. It was during full bloom before the flowers start falling and the leaves start to come out.Awfully crowded, but the park is big enough that you still can find some less crowded pathways and spaces if you need to take a break from the crowd. There are food stalls lined up at the lake and at the main park designated paths. I'm not sure if the stalls are there outside the Sakura season. I did not see many souvenir stalls but there were some antique goods sold flea market style.Be sure to go for the night walks during the sakura season, it's just wonderful. For a coffee lover like me, Starbucks is there to quench my need for caffeine.

Nice park but far away from other attractions in the area. Nice park but far away from other attractions in the area. There were lots of Sakura but if you are looking for those go to Shinjuju Gyoen or the imperial palace moat Chidoriga Fuchi

Very spaceous park. There are seversl museum inside the park. If u are over 65 or disable, most let u in free.u can find many plants n flowers there. But we did not visit the pandas. It was a sunny day when we were there. There is a very big shark statue in front of the science museum. Good to take photos

Love it. Went to it exactly when cherries where in full blossom. it is amazing, beautiful pathways with a lot of cherry trees. People having a good time admiring the flowers. It is a very nice park close to Ueno station.

Beautiful walk. We came here in February just before Cherry Blosson season, the trees looked a little bare, but it was still a beautiful stroll on a sunny February day! There were small shrines dotted here and there and museums dotted along the walk.
Great place to have a nice walk!

Nice Park for Hanami. Visited the park during the end of Mar and as expected, it was jammed full of people. There are paths lined with Sakura which we found great. Not as conducive for sitting down though, as compared to Shinjuku Gyoen. There's a nearby pond not to be missed too. Do take time to enjoy the boat rides on the pond. There's also a zoo and other museums in the park.

Very pretty . We came here to see a few cherry blossoms still out. The park is very versatile with a zoo, peony garden, temples, Starbucks and close to museums (which we will go back for). This was a great introduction to Tokyo

beautiful in cherry blossom season. we cycled through this park which was stunning with all its cherry blossom, although rather crowded. However, if you carry on through the park up to Yanaka Cemetery you can enjoy the blossom in relative peace and quiet. The park is not like Hyde Park in London for example, a lot of it is concrete and there aren't wide grassy open spaces which I found a bit strange. However lots of people take their picnic rugs anyway.

Cherry blossoms abound. Went the first weekend the cherry blossoms were at their peak, in the evening. So. Many. People. All laughing and having fun picnicking under the cherry blossoms. We enjoyed walking through and seeing the locals enjoying themselves. The blossoms, incomparably beautiful.

You can spend a whole day here...... a must visit. We came to this place after visiting sensoji temple. And we had a train ticket to Kyoto booked from Tokyo station at 4 pm. So we were really running out of time. But the 6 hours that we had in this park though less, was put to good use. We went past by the cherry blossom trees (the best in Tokyo). We also visited the Ueno Zoo in side the park and the kids really enjoyed looking at the Pandas. We also visited one of the six museums in the park. And at the end we had the street food available inside the park. The food was too good. Also there are many ice cream shops which people of all age will like. This place is just outside the Ueno station. We had three huge luggage which we had stored in the storage locker provided at the Ueno station and we went inside the park hands free. I highly recommend this place, for the Cherry blossom trees, The museum, the zoo and most importantly the cheap and delicious street food.

Wonderful park for a stroll and different sakura views. We took a short stroll on a Saturday morning around the main sakura path and to the lake. There was a musical wooden xylophone performer on one of the hills, and it was really enjoyable. At the lake, there were many food stands and some souvenir stands, and the atmosphere was lively. There were swan boats and regular boats for rent. The weather was breezy, and sakura snow blew in the wind. This is a really convenient park from Ueno station with a multitude of great spots for scenic shots and is a must see during Sakura season!!
It is a park.... Went there to walk around and see sakura - very very busy, tens of thousands local people pinic and drink under sakura trees, many were a bit tipsy as well

Blossoming cherries and hanami parties. Beautiful place to see when cherry blossoms are in full glory! Great spot for people viewing too! Alluring mix of natural delights, including a traditional Japanese garden and magnificent blooming branches lingering over ponds and lakes, with glimpses of high rise buildings.
Ueno Park. A lovely park to visit in spring time particularly when the cherry blossom is out, go visit Toshugu Shrine which is lovely.

Great Place for picnic under Sakura tree. Park, Shrine, and Zoo... pretty much like an all in one here. During Sakura season, it is a good idea to bring along your lunch box for a picnic here. On weekends it can be packed with both Japanese and tourist.

Perfect Place to be After/Before Shopping at Ameyoko Market. Lucky to be there during their Sakura season. Vancouver also has Cherry Blossom but it was way nicer when they are grouped in a park. Although it was packed with people due to public holidays, it was still a very enjoyable walk. On one side of the park, there were lots of street foods booths that sell lots of interesting local snacks. We didn't have much time to relax there but it was a nice walk before heading to Ameyoko Market for some serious shopping.

Nice place to walk. The park was a nice place to walk around and escape the city. It was recommended in our top 10 tour book. There are all kinds of good finds and temples and shrines in the park. Not a must do but a nice escape from the city.
Go during Hanami!. I went to this park five times during Hanami during the day and at night. It was the best part of the trip! I enjoyed it more than the food, temples, and shopping.

Spend an afternoon. A lovely place to spend an afternoon. View the sakura (in spring). Hire a peddle boat on the pond. See the polar bear at the zoo. Eat some snacks from the market stalls. While away the hours.

One day at Ueno was not enough. Visiting Ueno Park from early morning around 8am. Journey was start by walking around the park while enjoying sakura blooming. Many people doing picnic/hanami and gathering with friends. Then i came into Ueno Zoo to see Panda. Zoo has pretty much complete collection of animals. You can ride mono-train also inside the zoo.There are museums around Ueno Park, on my visit at Ueno, i had an opportunity to see museum music concert (music ensemble) at national museum of western art. At that time the museum was exhibit the paint collection of Carravagio, so that the music concert was inspired by Carravagio.At night, i came to Tokyo Bunka Kaikan that also located in Ueno Park to see the orchestra performance.

Perfect park to chill and relax. Been here a few times and always enjoyed the park especially during Sakura season. Good to visit with families and friends. The swan boat paddling is a must when visiting the park.

Beautiful during the Sakura period. It's a public park with a lot of picnic spots and an ideal place for young children. As we arrived during the Sakura period, there's lots blooming all over the park.

Pleasant place to spend the afternoon. This is a very large park; lots of shrines, and, on the weekends you might find live music performances and/or open-air food stalls. Gets a bit crowded (there was a P.A. announcement telling people to keep moving!), but if you get there early, it's a nice way to while away a couple of hours.

Over rated. Highly over rated Park. I visited at the end of March but there were hardly any full bloom cherry blossoms. It is very crowded and not worth the visit. There are so many other parks one can go to which are much... better.

Sakura Flowers. Went there to view the sakura trees. A nice place for walk with many people having their own picnic at the park.
Recommended to visit during Sakura season
Amazing park in the middle of the city. Ponds, shrines, a concert hall, museums, fountains, open air music and dance performances; and beautiful cherry trees!
Cherry blossom. Very nice view when cherry blossom period but so many people. Recommend to go in the early morning. Many nice snack such as takoyaki and grill fish

Sunday afternoon street food. We came out of the zoo at 5:15ish and walked around the park amongst the locals and the cherry blossom trees, the locals sit down by the side of the pathways (wheelchair/pushchair friendly), to eat as a family. It looked so inviting to picnic, and then we came across the street food vendors, selling barbecued sweet corn, and chicken satay like food on sticks and other hot delicious food. Opposite were tables with chairs and benches so if you couldn't sit on the floor you could still sit and eat. The only downside I think for accessibility, I remember a few stone steps leading to the area, but I don't remember any upon leaving, so if you need to, it may be best to ask for directions to gain entry without going up the steeps. People are so helpful, the Japanese, will go out of their way to help, even if you don't speak their language.

Interesting during cherry blossom. An everage park on other season but an interesting one during Cherry blossom time . Japanese people picnicking on the ground beneath the flowering trees while thousands of people walk past enjoying the brief blossom season!The cherry trees lining up the walkway and the falling cherry flowers after a strong breeze..... Amazing sights.

Wonderful cherry blossoms. We were here when the cherry blossoms were here in full bloom and it was wonderful. Nice to see all the Japanese having their cherry blossom picnics although the smell of alchohol was strong. A lovely park to walk round. Downside- try not to use the toilets, very smelly and dirty presumably due to the high numbers of people in the park.

Nice cherry blossom viewing area. A lovely (and extremely famous) place to go to see cherry blossoms in the spring. My favorite part of the park is around the famous, lovely pond right in front of the Tokyo National Museum. Over and above that, there are some mini shrines and a set of street food shops that are cool to gander at, but the main attraction comes in the spring. I'm sure it'd be pretty without the cherry blossoms too, though. Definitely check out the Ueno Zoo nearby if you get a chance; it's pretty big and is only 600 yen for adults!
Poeple's park. This is a popular park for local people in tokyo, especially in cherry blossom. Many family come to this place for gathering and they also have a night food market, very nice place

Cherry blossom . It was recommended to us to come to Ueno park for Sakura. We had anticipated it being busy but the amount of people there was out of this world. Every where you looked people gathered on blue plastic enjoying picnics and getting drunk on wine. It was really cool to experience it but I wouldn't recommend it if you want a romantic experience with your partner. We enjoyed Shinjuku Gyoen much more.

Great to enjoy sakura blooming. A park to enjoy. Stroll, have a nice picnic under a sakura tree in a bento box, se the lake and, if you want, choose a wonderful museum to visit. Ueno is a very traditional place in Tokyo.

Cherry Blossom spectacular. Great day at the park. Cherry Blossoms in full swing so beautiful but extremely busy (but manageable). Great atmosphere with lots of picnickers. Didn't do the zoo as there was a massive queue to get in. National museum there was really good. Had a go with the paddle boat - nice.

Huge park. This park includes many museums. We only visited the national museum but it was very boring (according to my taste).Walking around the park was nice as it was filled with Cherry blossom trees where you are able to picnic beside.Because of this peak season, many tourists as well as locals gather to see the cherry blossoms, making the park get really crowded.
Absolutely stunning. We went there last week and it was beautiful. Its spring time and the sakura were in full bloom. Absolutely stunning!

Lovely public space. A really wonderful public area. Lots of interesting little shrines scattered throughout. Beautiful pedestrian boulevard flanked by cherry blossoms. Bustling, but not chaotic or noisy. A lovely place.

Experience cherry blossoms raining down !. For a different kind of experience of the cherry blossoms, bring a matt and a picnic basket. The park allows visitors to sit under the cherry trees for a meal and perfect for people watching ... Not to mentioned being rained down by the cherry tree flower petals!! It's an excellent experience for this Vostok greatly April.

Beautiful park to view cherry blossoms. This is a beautiful park to view cherry blossoms. The are many trees that lined the path and it is a beautiful sight indeed. It is also a very popular place for Hanami parties for the local. The park authorities marked out clearly places where people can lay out their mat under the cherry blossom trees for a party. There are also street food stalls in the park to cater to hungry park visitors.
Beautiful park. Expansive park with stunning cherry blossoms. Great central pond where you can hire boats. Well worth the trip :)

Beautiful sakura!. We were lucky to visit when the sakura was in full bloom and people were enjoying the hanami on a weekend. It was crowded but the atmosphere was festive with people eating and drinking, folks in kimonos dancing and tourists just walking around admiring the beautiful sakura. My husband and nephew grabbed a glass of beer to be in tune with the people having their picnics. This was certainly one of the highlights of our Japan trip because it was only in Ueno Park where we were able to admire the sakura in all its glory. I certainly didn't mind the crowd because they were part of the whole experience.

Spacious park with many attractions. I've been here a few times but never really got around to visit every corner. Every time I came I found something new to marvel about. This time I was with my elderly parents to see sakura blooms and it's one of the prettiest place to watch it. In spite of the large crowd, it was still fairly easy to walk along the sakura tunnel and take many photos. Everyone else was doing the same thing but there were plenty of space to accommodate all. We had a very pleasant walk.

Cherry Blossom Season is amazing. The park is great to visit, especially this time of year. We went around the 25th March and then again about a week later and the change in the cherry blossom was amazing. People were lining the park on their tarpaulin areas with food and drinks and celebrating the spring, it was lovely to see.
Stunning in spring!. High recommend this park/ garden in spring as the blossoms are in full display and STUNNING! You can have a picnic on the park and lots of stall set up as well.

Great Sakura Experience . During the Sakura blossom seasons, this is a MUST place to visit. Even though it is very crowded, it is the best place to see Sakura.
Tip. Pack some food and drink, so you can sit back and relax!
Loevly Even in Winter. No cherry blossoms during the winter but still worth the visit. Walk around and visit the museums. Street performers are aplenty so not a boring moment.

A beautiful park. The cherry blossom trees were out in full bloom when we visited. This park is fabulous. There is the zoo and museums aplenty within the park grounds. Lots of people watching as the locals picnic under the cherry blossom trees. A great space to enjoy the sunshine and for the kids to run around. Well worth a visit (or two).

Packed with Hanami on cherry blossom season. I visited Ueno Park during the cherry blossom season. it was crowded and packed with people in group celebrating the season by 'picnic' style, some involve alcohol, karaoke. There was also a creative group sitting enjoying the cheery blossom by dressing up in kimono's, that is quite a lovely view. the cherry blossom trees around Ueno is indeed gorgeous, as long as you can ignore the crowd.

Gorgeous cherry blossoms, but busting with people. Ueno is absolutely stunning during cherry blossom season though it will be teeming with people. Tourists and locals all come out to enjoy the blossoms. It's a beautiful walk down the sidewalk under all the trees. There are paddle boats available for rental (though the pond was also crowed with boats!). It's worth your time though if you don't mind the crowds.

Cherry blossom picnic. We stumbled into the park quite oblivious to how the locals celebrate the cherry blossoms blooming. Picnic sheets and people everywhere. All seem to be having a lovely time with a hearty food and drink picnic to weedle the day away. Quite a spectacle seeing the trees in blossom and how welcome they are to the locals. The park also has a shrine, a zoo and many other attractions to fill an easy couple or few hours depending on much time you have. Great views across the river and stalls selling various foods and drinks. We thoroughly enjoyed the ambience and buzzing atmosphere. Try it for yourself and take as little or long time as you feel fit.

So beautiful to visit during the Cherry Blossom . Famed as being Tokyo's best park I visited here during Sakura blossom and it was a wonderful experience. To see all the locals out admiring this festive time of year in such beautiful surroundings was truly special.
chill. only sakara tree i see in that time. lots ofthe poeple try to selfie or take a nice shot with it. it will be full bloom now. i really wanna ho back. there is a shrine there to pray too
Amazing. Cherry blossom everywhere, amazing view and a very quiet place to rest. It is a must in your Places to visit in Japan

Stunning. A great place to go, have some lunch and just sit and relax.
The cherry Blossoms in full bloom are a site to see, and even if you go in Winter, still a place of Wonder!

Beautiful trees on the water. This is a great place to take a stroll on a sunny day, particularly if you're in Tokyo (like we were) during cherry blossom season. Nice wide walkways, and a path along the outside of a small lake at the southern end complete with an assortment of local birds and large fish. On one side, you also have the option of renting an obnoxious looking swan-shaped pedal boat, if that's your thing, or chuckling at them from the shore if it's not. A little busy in the late morning, but still room to breathe.
Beautiful oasis in Tokyo. Spend at least a whole afternoon here. Between the museums, shrines, and gorgeous strolls Ueno deserves the time.

Great place for sakura watching. Ueno park is one of the best places to enjoy the cherry blossom season. One both sides of the walking track, there are plenty of cherry blossoms where people will picnic under the trees. While it is a great spot to capture beautiful sakura, it was somehow too crowded filled with locals as well as tourists. In ueno park, there is a zoo, temple and museums as well. Other than sakura watching, those places worth a visit if there is spare time.

Ueno Park Review. Went to Ueno Park yesterday , it was very easy to get to and the Cherry Blossom was amazing . A lovely day with Blossoms , food stalls, Carp in the pond it really was excellent . If you are in Japan you must go and see this place and its free.There is also the Zoo and galleries
Sakura viewing in Ueno. Sakura is a special event in Japan, so in Ueno Park are lots and lots of people celebrating the new cherry blossoms. Come and enjoy, don't worry about the crowd.

Amazing Sakura. We took our three year old and five year old to see the sakura. Wow it didn't disappoint. The crowds are heavy but you can find place to hide. There was wonderful street food set up for lunch. Don't miss out.

Just lovely . Walking through this park was just lovely. Cherry blossoms in full bloom so groups of people sitting beneath them added to the atmosphere. Beautiful shrines dotted around the park so was fantastic to explore. Great food and drink stalls allowed us to sit and soak up the experience and being in such a wonderful place

Cherry blossoms with fantastic crowds!. Ueno park is one of the best places to see Cherry Blossom during the end of March and beginning of April! However be prepared that the entire park will be crowded and filled full with people who are there simply to enjoy the trees with a picnic (with good food and wine to accompany)! You have to reserve a great spot to enjoy this

Good place for rest. I just love to go and have a walk around the park. You may see some people do street performance, people sell their painting/artwork or just jog around the park. Good place to see the blooming Sakura too!

a lot of sakura tree. Another best spot to see sakura tree during spring. A long the way there're a lot of sakura tree. When I visit, there's already a lot visitor, some just walking under sakura tree taking picture, some even having a picnic. Great for photography, if you don't mind with crowded kind of scenery. Best time to visit around late march and early april

Beatiful Cherry blossom trees. We were lucky To see these gorgeous Cherry blossom Trees just blooming. Entire both side of street were all pink. So many people were Drinking partying Under the trees. It was like festival. Just beautiful. So many food stands if you like street food.

Great Visit for Families. Beautiful park in Tokyo just outside of Ueno station. My kids 6 & 8 loved it here. Great place for a picnic lunch (you can pick up lunch items at local stores). There was a small playground for the kids to play and a lake where they watched the koi swim about. We also visited the temple on the lake. We were lucky enough to visit when cherry blossoms were starting to bloom, and folks were taking part in festivities (hanami). You can also rent a row boat or pedal boat. We did the pedal boats (600-700 yen), which was a lot of fun.

Beautiful sakura at Ueno. We were happy to find that a few sakura trees had blossom when we went there on 16th March. They were so beautiful and we were quite satisfied taking pictures with them...hope we could go there again next time we visit Japan.
Busy this time of year! . Lots of people about checking out the sakura, entertainers, musicians, food stalls, plenty to see, extending into the evening

Beautiful Cherry blossoms!. We went to this park for this year's blossoms, both during the day and after dark for the illumination. Juat beautiful! Two things to be aware of though: the massive crowd and the constant reminders of thefts via the pa system.

Excellent for Hanami. Ueno park is just across the road from Ueno Station. It's free to get in and is a really pleasant place to have a wander. The lake is huge and there are a number of temples/shrines along with a kids play area and a Starbucks (great wi-fi). The area with Sakura is quite big and very beautiful. The Zoo is also very good (see separate review).Would definitely go again.

Best cherry blossoms . Maybe we just timed it right but the avenues of trees made this the best display of cherry blossoms we saw in Tokyo. Huge crowds enjoying them, very atmospheric. Great stroll from station to Tokyo National Museum through here.

Cherry blossom time! People everywhere!. The park and lakes are very pretty, if hugely over-crowded on the day we visited. 1. It was a school holiday and thousands of children were visiting the zoo (within the park) and it was Cherry blossom time so loads of locals were celebrating.It was very interesting to see how the locals celebrate the cherry blossom. They sit in groups, on plastic sheeting, under the trees with cardboard tables and lots to eat and drink. there was lots of singing and laughing.
Wonderful! Cherry blossoms everywhere . Great place to go - cherry blossoms everywhere- entrance, pond Very crowded People feed the birdsThere is a cat on the cherry blossoms treeFun place to visit

Great in Cherry Blossom Season . This was a great spot to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom. There are also a few temples dotted around the park. The lake is quite interesting as well, though we opted against hiring a paddle boat.

Beautiful during cherry blossom time. Great park especially this time of year with the sakura/cherry blossoms blooming. There is a shrine and a zoo very close to explore also. There were food venders probably for the cherry blossoms. While there were many people it wasn't overwhelmingly crowded. One of the places to definitely check out if you have time while you're in Tokyo. So beautiful.

Park, blossoms, and street food. The cherry blossoms were blooming and I didn't have to go to far to see the beautiful park and action packed city of Ueno. I recommend going in later afternoon closer to sunset.. The sunlight brings out a beautiful glow in the flowers, there's street food venues near by, and and out door-ish market to explore. Don't forget the hidden side streets where delicious restaurants are hiding! Worth my day and time for sure!! Hit a bucket list item

Great combo: BLOSSOMS, ZOO & SHRINE. Great combo: let's you see the cherry blossoms, as there is a large number of them! Sight of hanami is ... well, surprising and unforgettable. ;)) The ZOO, with 2 Pandas, makes up for the north end of the park. An interesting shrine is located in the middle of the park.

Big park with different things to do. Nice park. It had a lot of things to do and there was also small acts being played with people dressed in costumes. There is a zoo and shrine near by. This park isn't like a actual park but has lots of space, it wasn't too crowded and lots of stuff for kids. So if you are traveling with kids be sure to take them here. They will enjoy it!

Sakura viewing or just chill. A very pleasant and interesting park to just hang around and relax. We were there for some sakura (early bloom) on a Sunday and were pleasantly surprised to see many Japanese having picnic and fun. A nice park to visit.
Sakura. Very pretty park and an ideal place to experience the exploding spring bloom. It's crowded (of course) but it's also abundantly landscaped and a beautiful location to take in the Sakura.

beautiful park. I was at ueno park yesterday. It was crowded & sakura trees start to bloom. I & my husband had a nice walk at the park. There were street food vendors by the lake. We found grilled corn, crab cake on stick, takoyaki, french fries & many more.

Cherry blossom paradise. The best part about the cherry blossom is about watching the locals have picnics under the trees though out the park. Also saw opera and dancing as part of the cherry blossom festival. Breathtaking!

Super busy. A park, in my opinion, needs to be a place of nature, with more trees than people. Ueno is not that. Granted, it is cherry blossom season so everyone wants to be here, but still. The slaps of grass have tarps on them where people are chilling and sleeping, all the roads are overcrowded, taking a picture without a person on it is impossible. I know we're in a big city and it is to be expected but one can find more peace in Hyde park London.

Beautiful start to spring. The cherry blossoms have just started to bloom and its worth going to the park just to see them!
On the weekend they have a fair there but during the week they have food markets near the water with all different types of food! Worth visiting.

Beautiful park. My party visited Ueno park during the sakura festivals and I have to say it was a wonderful park. Everything was well kept and beautiful. The temples you could go to made it interesting. All in all I would recommend going to this park.
Beautiful place. Everything you could possibly want to see, contained within a park. Kept coming back over the course of my holiday, often just to eat lunch by the amazing fountain.

Nice park, but crowded.. We visited the park at the end of March to see the cherry blossom. It turned out that we were not the only one, the park was very crowded. This is the best place we found to watch the cherry blossom, one more week and it will be perfect. Lots of people having lunch in the park.

Lovely park. The blossom was starting to come out as we walked through the park and like many other parks in Greater Tokyo, this makes for big crowds and very pretty views. We were also lucky with the weather and it made for a glorious stroll.

Lots to see and do. The park is large and easy to walk around, containing many statues of various historical figures (including Saigo Takamori) and museums including the Tokyo National Museum as well as a baseball field. It is the centre of an arts cultural zone. A map (which you can get from the parks administration office) is essential to make the most of all the sites including shrines and a bell of time (similar to the one at Asakusa). I visited during cherry blossom time when many people were there and food stalls were in full swing but there would be lots to look at at other times of the year. It is next to all the Ueno stations. Whilst there was plenty of cherry blossom, the picnic areas are not as attractive as other parks where you can sit on the ground under the trees - here it is mainly on asphalt but there were excellent rubbish collection stations.
Beautiful wander amongst other cultural and shopping attractions. Cherry blossoms starting their magic when I visited. A lovely place, I wish I can visit the museums and art galleries next time!

Oh what a lovely day!. Today is Saturday, 26 March, 2016. It's Easter Saturday. It's sunny (the first sunny day we've seen in Tokyo) and quite warm. The cherry blossoms are starting. And we went to Ueno Park. Yep, it was packed! But what a vibe!It's basically party time in Tokyo - the locals (and us tourists) were out in force. The locals were having picnics around the statues and under the cherry blossoms. The film crews were out in force. Some ladies were in traditional kimonos. It's a big deal.Lots of stalls and concessionaries. We had a glass of champagne at the Chandon concession - pink champagne, of course.There's the zoo, some shrines etc, ice cream, a few rides for the kids. People are dressed up. Beer concessions. Wine is available. Pottery, jewellery.We had street food for lunch - octopus balls and squid cooked in front of us (there's tamer food too).Oh what a lovely day! (said like Nicholas Hoult in Mad Max Fury Road!). It was awesome.

Park & Picnic under the Cherry Blossom. It is a beautiful park full of cherry blossom trees that have just started to bloom. The place is quite self contained with cafes, museum, zoo, pond and street foods. Many people brought food to the park for picnic or you can just sit by the lake to enjoy both the view and the Japanese snacks..
Nice pak only in April. we were there late march, not much to see yet, need to wait till cherry blossom season , beside that it's a park like any other, unless you're visiting from a dry country.

Nice and relaxing . Massive spacious area. Beautiful on a sunny day and perfect for people watching or a nice leisurely stroll around. there are entertainers dotted around every so often and a nice large water feature for people to sit and chill around. There was an icecream van when we went which added to the nice atmosphere. Lots of children and people walking their dogs. Great place to read a book. Anything you want really.
Nice Park for cherry blossom viewing & People watching. Great park to walk around in especially during Sakura - the cherry blossom season. Definitely don't miss the zoo if you have children with you.

Getting crowed but full of interesting things and events. Every time I visit Tokyo I avoid Ueno as I thought it was touristy.For the sake of chasing the cherry blossoms (Early bloom) I have decided to visit Ueno park on my last day of travel.Ueno park is touristy but still lots of fun, there are many locals and currently running a small art fair run by some university art students. Nice moment to experience some local activities.There's a cat sleeping on a cherry blossom tree I just wonder if it was staged or just a regular cat.

People watching, dog watching,and Cherry Blossons. Bring a book and sit at the Starbucks (the only one inside a Park or Garden in Tokyo) and spend a couple of hours recharging and soaking up the sun. There's a lot to see on weekends too with entertainment and activities.The park is sufficiently large and there are beautiful trees and Sakuras in bloom late-March to early-April. The Japanese take their 'hanami' (cherry blossom viewing) very seriously and on weekends you will see lots of locals having picnics in the park with their friends, family and pets. If you have a few more hours, it is worth the few hundred yen to talk a walk through the Zoo as well!

UENO ZOO. The park is near the zoo and the museum.The park has a duck boat which is mainly the main attraction in the UENO park.It is very pleasant to visit in mainly the season of Sakura ( cherry blossom) .It is fun to go their with young children because they enjoy it.

Large park with lots going on. Walked round the park after a visit to the national museum. It is a bit of a giant footpath but it is very popular with locals, there were literally thousands there when we went on weekday so it's good for people watching. There are also a number of temples around the park which are worth a look, the main one has a magnificent gold door and there are times you can go in though this wasn't one of them. A little hidden was a rather sobering perpetual flame from Hiroshima. We were there when the first blossoms were emerging and there was a big scramble to photo then by locals which was entertaining.

This is Tokyo. Ueno Park is Toyko all over - from the beautiful peaceful nature on the edge of crazy traffic just a turned corner away from non traditional housing villages to all the museums and tourist attractions for both domestic and international tourists. As everything from the north comes through Ueno it is where many Japanese people experience Toyko. This time was still winter and the park is lovely, but, as any guide book will tell you, Cherry Blossom season is when this place goes crazy and is also at its most beautiful. Pro tip is to walk around the whole park and see its diversity - not just near the main entrance and museums.

Take time out of busy Tokyo. Ueno Park is an expansive area in Tokyo housing major museums, a zoo, a lake, small temples and recreation area. No doubt it would be filled with blossom trees in Spring. We visited the Shitamachi museum which was a recreation of a 100 year old house, which we thoroughly enjoyed, and also the Tokyo National Museum which houses historical Japanese costumes and artefacts.
For the whole family. I enjoyed touring the whole place, checking out the variety of animals and its very friendly to young children and seniors as well

Relaxing place on a sunny day. We had a pleasant walk after visiting the zoo. There is a lake where you can watch the locals crashing into each other in boats. It must be amazing soon at blossom time.

No cherry blossoms yet. Very nice park with a couple of museums nearby and the Zoo. The cherry trees have started to blossom, but I recommend to visit anyway as there are better parks/gardens for cherry blossoms.

Must visit in Cherry blossom season. Cherry blossoms are grown along side of the path. Very very beautiful in The beginning of April and Octorber. Suit to family with child, friends, and couple. It's very popular in Tokyo.

Typical park in Japan. Nice walk through the park during the day. Don't be upset if you miss out on this. Similar to alot of parks within Japan. Would recommend going in Spring for cherry blossom season.

Huge Park Filled with Things to See and Do. You can wander and be entertained by buskers of all kinds. If museums are your cup of tea there are several. Hungry or thirsty the choices are plentiful. Spend the day or just an hour or two.
Best time to visit is mid April. I come too early so I cant have the best view of cherry blossom.but I still enjoy the environment there.

beautiful park. We are staying very close to Ueno and have frequented the park at least 2-3 times this trip. We barely missed the sakura season but several trees there bloomed early. It's absolutely beautiful. The park is quite big and centrally located with museums and the zoo close by. There are also a lot of shopping and restaurants around. Will definitely stay here again next time we come to Tokyo,

Lovely Park, Must See. What a lovely place to just chill in, there are some performers. mini farmers market, with a beautiful fountain perfect for picture taking. The park is surrounded by great museums, National Museum of Nature and Science which has a 360-degree movie theater & exhibits on dinosaurs & evolution. then the Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum which has a lot of Japan's national treasures and the National Museum of Western Art Good museum with collections of Monet, Renoir, Picasso Van Gogh and some sculptures of Rodin. Ofcourse what really popular with the kids is the Ueno Zoo whose main attraction is the PANDA. they also have Shinobazu Pond which is partially covered in lotus plants. There are also some temple & shrines in the Area. So much to do. If your you can just sit down in a corner of the park and enjoy the view. In the spring it's filled with Cherry Blossoms.

a must see while in Tokyo. I went there on winter, and I gotta say that I did not expect it to be that beautiful, a very peaceful place to visit, lots of nature and many things to see. I went to Ueno park twice, I had the chance to visit the Cience museum, the 360 theater is awesome. Then you can go around the park which is really nice. I also went to the Zoo and tokyo university while visiting Ueno park, If you like the pandas you must go to the zoo.

Great for a day out. Great park in the lively Ueno district. Home to temples and shrines as well as the cities museums and art galleries. Just to the north of the park is Yanaka, a neighbourhood of small streets with interesting shops and also the Yanaka Beer Hall,which is tiny but well worth the visit.

beautiful park. as a man I have never liked parks with some flowers only but since I went to UENO PARK that changed the way I think about parks the air was so pure and clean and the Cherry blossom trees are so beautiful and it became my favorite
Truly Amazing!!!!!. This place is amazing full of Sakura trees..however, this place must visit during mid of april.. If you want to see full-bloomed sakura..
Pleasant outing. Nice park to wander about, a few entertaining buskers. Enjoyable afternoon if wanting some respite and a bit of greenery.

Wonderfully entertaining precinct for families. We had a 4yo who needed to burn off energy - and Ueno park certainly delivered. Lots of open spaces, a small playground, and many interesting things to see. We visited the Nature and Science Museum - the dinosaur exhibit was a big hit, were lucky enough to see some trees with cherry blossoms, and explored the large park area. There is also a zoo (which we did not visit due to time constraints) and multiple other museums and historic sites/attractions.We spent about 4 hours here - and could easily have spent more. A must see

Would be more beautiful in cherry blossom season. We were disappointed there wasn't more "park" - there were a lot of concrete pathways connecting museums and other buildings! But the main pathway, lined with cherry blossom trees, would be spectacular in the sakura season. We checked out the temples and the eternal flame of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

First stop in Tokyo. This was our first stop on our first day of sightseeing in Tokyo. It was a wonderful walk, with so many cherry blossoms, temples and shrines to explore, and great food from the local vendors for lunch. Allow a few hours to take your time exploring.

Nice park in the middle of the urban jungle. It is a nice green park in Ueno. It has a national museum that was interesting to visit. If you get there during the bloom time it is quite nice.It is not a sight that you should plan to visit as a single objective for a day in Tokyo. However if you are in the Ueno area then it is recommended you visit the park and the museum. It is near the Keisei station Ueno and of course close to JR Ueno so you can walk it all up and combine this visit with shopping or eating in Ueno. I would recommend a half day visit at maximum.

My Visit To Ueno Park. I actually visited the park in March 2015. The drop down dates only go as far back as April 2015. I stayed in a hotel near the park. I decided to go for a stroll. Very nice, clean, relaxing place. The park is very big. It has a Zoo, and some museums.

Nice central park in Tokyo with the Tokyo National Museum ... which is quite nice!!. Nice central park in Tokyo with the Tokyo National Museum ... which is quite nice!!Good for a stroll but we went in the winter so it was not that great because of the cold ... maybe it is better when the cherry blossoms are out.
Fountains. Big and attractive park with lots of fountains.Sit down and just admire the blossoms.Great place to be with children.

A lot to do in 1 area. Just visited Ueno park, although it is still not the season to walk around the park it was nice and relaxing, you have a lot of attraction for this considerably smaller area. Ueno zoo and the nearest Art museum are interesting especially for a family outing

Overrated . I don't usually write reviews but I felt like there needs to be some honesty here. Nothing relaxing or interesting about these "gardens" (as suggested in the other reviews). Crowded, below average maintenance and not much to see compared with botanical gardens elsewhere. Save your time and see some of tokyos other great sights instead :)
Clam and beautiful. This place is beautiful and peace in the morning.its very clean and walk to left side so that u c the small shrine.

something for everyone. i found this park more inspiring and serene than the temples i have been visiting. it is remarkable to see how well they care for the foliage. it is surrounded by museums and galleries. i will fit back when the blossoms are out and it will be breathtaking. one of prettiest and most relaxing places in tokyo.

one of best cherry blossom spot. It is one of the best (also most crowded) place for cherry blossom spot. It is deserved for a visit. The museum is of high quality. The park is clean with good view. For family, it is one of the popular place for a picnic. The location is also near to the Ueno JR.

A Chance to unwind from the city. Being able to walk around the grounds on Sunset during my stay, at Inaricho. Was a way of unwinding from the city bustle.
There are many attractions within the park or just sit by the lake and take it all in.
Great place to have an afternoon run or walk.

awesome park with lots of museum and zoo. Visit during winter,cannot see any sakura blossom, but the park was clean, tidy and large.Some areas were in renovation. There are many museum inside the park, also got a little zoo. For those who enjoy architectural building, can saw Le Corbusier masterpiece also. Unfortunately we cannot find any bicycle rental, it is nice if we can bike inside the park.There are some restaurants nearby. Overall, worth to visit with your family.
Must place in tokyo. Very nice parkSurrounding by temples and museums Good place to start or finish day tour in tokyoLots of restaurants in the area as well as shopping

Lovely in all seasons. Lots of flora and fauna, lovely in all seasons. We always walk here when in Tokyo. Especially nice on a Saturday when you see grandparents with their grandchildren often in traditional dress.

Great Park, recommend visiting in spring . The park is great, with lots of trees, beautiful ponds and trails. I went there in winter, so all the trees and aquatic plants were dry or dead. I can imagine that in spring /summer it might be very great! Very close to the park there's a zoo :) besides the shrines and all. You can do many different things at this one place. I strongly recommend that!
lovely. lovely park with lots of trees and a pond around.beautiful place for a walk.a shrine is located at the site.

Emotional walking place. There were many ponds in this park
Gooses are swimming in crowd
Shrine was in the center of park
God of Glasses fish and ect were served in that place
it seems like the natives like to walk on park with pets
Totally park was quiet and comfortable.

Serenity in the midst of hustle-bustle. I could spend the whole day here (2.5hrs was simply not enough). Huge park with numerous shrines, museum, galleries, and a zoo (wow!). Great for family outings and gatherings. Will hopefully visit again for the cherry blossoms. Great for photo enthusiasts
Beautiful green park. Ueno park is a good place to relax and take a good walk, lots of trees and things to look around. Take the time and watch street performers. Definitely would come back!

Lovely Place to Walk in Tokyo. We were staying in the Ueno district so we decided to spend one of our days in Tokyo exploring the park and its many galleries and museums. We arrived at the park before most things opened so we took a little walk around the pond, which is choked full of lotuses. It looked like an actual pond on our map, so it was a little surprising to see it look more like a field in person, but it was interesting and we also got to see some turtles and koi in the water. There is plenty to see in the park; we visited the Bentendo temple and the Tosho-Gu shrine, and strolled along the tree lined walkways (we were a little early for the Autumn leaves, and I believe the trees are a sight to behold when the cherries are blossoming). We were going to be grown-up-adult type people and visit museums and galleries all day, but instead we went to the zoo in the morning and visited the Museum of Nature and Science in the afternoon to make up for our morningly lapse. We ended up going to the zoo because the entrance fee was ridiculously cheap compared to British zoos, and they had a panda (I'd never seen a panda before, it definitely seemed worth the price!).The museum had some interesting exhibits, and the roof garden was a lovely place to sit and relax. You could probably spend a whole day exploring just the Nature and Science Museum, let alone the rest of the museums in the park, so if you are staying in Tokyo for any length of time definitely set some time aside to explore Ueno Park, because there is something for everyone.While the zoo seemed very cheap compared to UK prices you do have to pay for entry to museums in Japan, so bear that in mind when budgeting for your time in the park (especially if you would like to visit a few museums; you won't be able just to nip in and out of them).

Lovely peony display. First time visiting Ueno Park and was surprised by the size of it, plenty of exercise for the group. Visited the current peony exhibition, the flowers on display were varied and beautiful. The exhibition was very neat, with some nice music playing in the background which added to the ambience and the group of us really enjoyed taking photos of the flowers as we strolled through.
Disappointing. Not much to see in winter and it looks like renovations are being carried out. May be improved by spring...

Nice park with lots of activities . A really nice park with stuff to do for everyone, lots of museum, zoo, playground for children and temple and places to eat food or burgers or ice cream. Easy access by train, Jens train station

A pleasant morning stroll. We walked around the park on a cold but sunny day in midweek. there were loads of people about and it was very nice after the clamour of the market by the train station.. the temple is across a busy road and was completely boarded up for renovations,, a sign at the main entrance would help let people know that this temple is closed....

Something for Everyone. We visited on a winter's day with bright sunshine. Ueno Park has so many attractions packed into it, we didn't know where to start.The park itself is charming and we saw street performers, locals with strollers, retirees and couples. This place is ageless and has an ageless appeal. On one side was the Tokyo National Museum, on the other, the recently renovated Toshogu shrine. Kaneiji Temple is close by, with its 5 different historical buildings. The science museum and the Metropolitan Art museum are also at this complex.Basically, there is enough on site for us to spend two whole days to explore. As we were pressed for time, we chose to see the shrines and temples.This park is well worth a visit, for any reason. It is very much tied to the history of Tokyo and of Japan.

Beautiful surrounds. Found this area to be a lovely part of town in Ueno. It was easy to walk around and had several maps so you knew where you were. Interesting things to see along the way and a nice place to take a sandwich and watch the world go by. We also liked the interesting street artist that was at the park that day. Nice and close to public transport , would visit again!
Worth a stroll whether at night or the daytime. If you want to spend more time at Ueno Park, it is easy to with the various sights and restaurants in there.
beautiful. very beautiful park. nice to sit, have a picnic and enjoy the panoramic view. i went during the winter season, it was nice.
No playground??. How can such a massive Park have no playground for kids? If it's there, it isn't on the maps.......a bit surprising. Oh well

Beautiful sanctuary in the middle of a huge city!!. This is another must see!! Take your time and browse and soak in all the beauty!! There's ponds and cherry blossom trees and lots of greenery. It's a very well manicured place!!

A pleasant walk, nice green space in the city. Popular with couples and families, would be nice out of winter but still a pleasant walk and interesting watching local families on the lake where you can hire paddle boats shaped as swans (700 yen for 30 mins). Some local food stalls and nearby temples.

Relaxing park. Ueno park is accessible from Ueno station, when exiting ueno station just take the pedestrian crossing located right in front of it and walk straight. Ueno park is the link to Ueno Zoo, Ameyoko Shopping Stree, National Museum of Nature and Science, Tokyo, and many other museums!

A little of Japanese for Everyone. From cherry trees, to the zoo, to baseball field, to various types of art museums, to outdoor food snacks huts, to nature, ponds with wildlife, there is so much to see and do for everyone in the family. Recommended during the spring or fall as the best times, but even in the middle of winter, there is so much to do and shopping streets are no more than 10 minutes away when you want to do something else.
