Nice place to stroll. I must say the best time to visit this park is during the Sakura season. there is a Museum at one end of the park. Did not get a chance to go in but I think it should be a nice place.
nice view, nice atmosphere. it was nice walking around the area, people were not so smiley but if you approach them, they're willing to help.
Great city break. Ueno Park was a nice break from the city. It's a great place to explore full of nature, temples and museums.

Ueno Park is a wonderful park in Tokyo. Ueno Park is easy to get to using the extensive Tokyo metro system. Just go to Ueno Station and walk a short distance up a gradual hill of about one-half mile. Restaurants, cafes, shops, entertainers, concet hall museums, and Ueno Zoo.
A nice stroll in the park. With monuments, temples, memorials, and museums around and in the park it is a great way to spend a few hours in Tokyo.

Refreshing in summertime. Nice place, near Ueno station... A green spot in the big city. You can catch a tourist bus for a minimum fee and explore the neighbourhood.... A very interesting cemetory, a nice museum, a nice little restaurant... Good for a half day....

Tokyo Museum + Ueno Park. When visiting Tokyo national museum, you'll certainly also pass through ueno park. We found it a great experience, also to learn about the traditional handwashing which is explained in one of the temples in Ueno park. Like all places in Tokyo, this is a very busy place, and during weekends you'll also find people performing traditional dances, and often also markets close to the Museum.

Nice park to escape the crowds. Lovely big park with some minature torii gates and a few temples scattered around. Wide open spaces so you don't feel overwhelmed by people and a great place to chill out for a while.We wandered through on the way to exploring Yanaka.

Chilly day of wonderful sights. I imagine in Spring, this place is divine. Nice walk among historic buildings, a shrine, statues, a lake, park, street performers and more. A nice way to spend an afternoon.
Wei no. It was ok. Not much happening in winter and quite a lot of construction happening. Perhaps it's preparations for the 2020 games.

Beautiful red leaves!. Just in time to see the beautiful red leaves on the Ueno park. The park is spacious, quiet and beautiful.The zoo in Ueno park is a bit small, but is perfect for children and families who want a closer interaction with the animals.

An Oasis. This is a space in the middle of the city full of temples, museums and some restaurants. Pick a nice day because this pace requires a lot of walking and does involve a few steps. The heavy concentration of tourist attractions makes this a little bit amusement park feeling however most attractions are good. The temples however contain very little in the way of descriptions of the significance of what is being seen so a little background research may go a long way in your enjoyment. the amount of activities in this area can also be overwhelming so come with an idea of what you want to see because it is impossible to see it all in one day. The park its self specially the lotus flowers make it nice to also just walk around in without visiting any attractions
A park with lots of attractions around. A nice park with wide walking areas, temples, shrines, a zoo, street performers, museums etc. Allocate at least half a day for it.

A bit like the DC area. Don't make a whole trip out of it, but Ueno Park is prett neat. Tulips flowering in December, people picnicing. This whole area reminds me of DC in the best possible way. If you are already checking out the museum, might as well stroll through. They do craft markets sometimes too. There is a zoo nearby and great ramen and ice cream close too. Don't settle for Starbucks beause it's in your face. Dig just a little deeper.

Great park, it appeared to be the place to go to hang out wheth. This park appeared to be the place people when to hang out. I was surprised at the amount of families and dog owners who were walking around this part on a winter afternoon. Exercise and staying active appeared to be important an part of life in Japan as I saw people of all ages in this part.
Beautiful park with many attractions nearby. A very pleasant park to stroll along and people watch. There are also a number of museums nearby and the zoo is there as well.

A fantastic, relaxing, green space in the heart of Tokyo. I great place to escape the bright lights and noise of Tokyo. I enjoyed a lovely 4 hours or so visiting sites in the park. There are places for lunch and shrines to visit. The park has plenty of information boards that tell you what things of interest you can go and see.
Ueno Park. Huge, huge park, lots to do and see. You could spend a whole day here!Beautiful park to just simply walk around.

City Park with landmark and museums. Best time to visit is in April/May for sakura or Nov/Dec for autumn leaves. The water fountain presentation is epic and one of a kind -- unique. There is a few national museums inside the park and nice cafe and restaurants. Very romantic for couples.

Definitely worth a good half day wander...at least. I made the mistake of only allowing an hour and a half to wander around Ueno Park and I certainly did not to it justice. Ueno Park is huge and is a bit like a variety store: it has a bit of everything! It has all the major museums, a zoo, shrines, lakes, well maintained parkland... Go check it out! A half day would have to be your minimum time...there.
Nicely maintained. It is right at the center of the city, yet you feels calm and fresh. During evening it is filled with lot of performers who make the place lively. It is a must see park.

very wide, very clean. Although i went there in december and didnt get to see the cherry blossoms, the park as it is, is still good to visit. Wide walking areas, with different performers located strategically around, it provides a nice respite from the commercialism going on with other tourist spots in japan. This park didnt have all those shopping and food stalls that pepper the surroundings towards a shrine or temple, which makes this park a lot more relaxing. There are small temples here as well, plus a few old houses somewhere in the interior. Because of the holidays, the museum was closed, which was a shame because they had on display, but up to february only, the terracotta warriors statues.

good to visit all year around. but the best season to go there is spring, when the cherry blossoms are blooming. end of March to beginning of April. You can experience how Japanese admire cherry blossoms and enjoy themselves with foods and drinks under the trees.
Park, Zoo, Museums. Park, Zoo and many museums....i recommend the National museum.....Zoo is great too. you can combine with a trip to the busy old market of AMEOKO...nearby.
Beautiful park. It is a big park near Ueno station and near the famous Ameyokocho market. If you just want to chill out, relax and enjoy the day visit Ueno park.

Beautiful, rather small park. Ueno Park is gorgeous, if you have seen any Japanese television shows then I will bet my left arm you'll feel like you're in one when you arrive. And that was in November before the peak of autumn...I cannot imagine how amazing (and crowded!!) it would be in spring. I had a lovely time walking and just taking in the air. You can also choose to drop by the museums dotted around the park area if just walking in park doesn't sound like your kind of thing - I think there are 3. Best thing to do here? Grab a cup of coffee and a sweet, sit near the fountain and make some conversation with the Japanese families chilling in the area.It's a stone's throw away from Ueno station, follow the schoolchildren and old folks and you won't get lost.

One of the best cherry blossom viewing. Went here last week of March 2015 when the cherry blossoms is in full bloom. Awesome view. Best time to go is early in the morning when its not crowded yet. Must see in Tokyo during the sakura season.

Worth a visit. Do come here, particularly during the cherry blossom season. It is very lovely, though rammed with people. A good space to get out of the high rise buildings and catch your breath. Some places to eat nearby, a shrine, and a museum

Wonderful free afternoon out. Massive, spacious, clean park in the city centre. Dotted with performers, places to eat, a shrine, a zoo, a lake and plenty of wildlife yet not too crowded. Beautiful place to come and simply walk around or bring a picnic and sit beneath the trees. If on a budget, you must visit and spend a peaceful afternoon out of the city...in the city.
A must-see in Tokyo. Ueno Park is a very beautiful park and large. It has a temple in the Park. It's so interesting. If you plan to Tokyo, you've to visit here!

Good for young kids. Good for young ones. Scooter and bike friendly. Some free play areas and a small rides area which is 500yen for 6 rides. Museum and other attractions very close. Also a temple nearby. Starbucks and another cafe close too.

Short park visit. We came to the park on a busy Sunday after New Years, so quite crowdy but this is probably true on any Sunday. The zoo is currently hosting pandas and there are many temples and shrines where people are making their New Years blessings.

A park you don't get to see that often. A nice park, not far from train station. Quite huge for a park I'll say. With performer in the morning(till noon) don't recall much but it's enjoyable. You can also take a nap under the tree(it felt good in Autumn). There's a zoo and shrine nearby and also a small baseball park where local team/students practice there. Walk a little further you'll reach the town.

museums, sakura, street shows and more. there are many different museums depending on what you are interested in.One of the best places to see the sakura in May for free. You can go on picnics there. Japanese businessmen camp there from the late night, so it might be impossible to find a spot to sit. I don't drink, so the alcohol stink was a negative.Toilets are not well kept, but there is a mall near by.In the afternoon, there are many street performers. Good for children. There aren't many places to throw your trash.

Nice park. Ueno Park is a very pleasant place to visit. There is a small pond in the middle and footpath for you to walk around.The Ueno Zoo is located to the North of the park. There is also a shrine and museum in the vicinity of the park.If you want to relax and 'escape' from the hustle and bustle of the city, this is an ideal place for you to do so.
Recommended for Sakura viewing. Ueno Park is very big and there's a small zoo too. Good for strolling and walk around. Too bad i missed the sakura timing :(

Nice park. a very nice and clean park, not the best time in winter - lack of leaves and not a lot of flowers. Preparing a peony exhibition from 1/1 to 2/29 2015. Looking above fences they looked gorgeous (bad luck for us too early !). Pond is also nice, with benches to rest and have sun in winter.

Best for a casual/leisure walk. The park was huge, with various museums residing in it. We wanted to visit the National Museum of Nature & Science but it was on renovation. So we took a leisure stroll around and I must say the park was so clean and tranquil that I wouldn't mind staying longer.

Very pleasant experience in the heart of the city. We spent our first day in Tokyo at the Ueno Park and Zoo and it was a great experience, especially for the tiny tots. We spent the entire day at the premises, and enjoyed the clean and serene surroundings and the wide variety of exhibits. There is a fair bit of walking involved, as is the norm in many places in Japan. Please ensure to carry plenty of fluids, the food and beverages options (especially for vegetarians) inside is limited. The closes decent restaurants are in the Ueno Station which is a short walk away. The monorail inside which takes you between the two zoo sections is a bit overpriced, while there is a walking path connecting the two, please be aware that it would take an extra 10 to 15 minutes at least and may be difficult with kids in tow. The panda and gorilla exhibits were the most exciting.

Beautiful park in the heart of Tokyo. A real gem right in the heart of Tokyo - a good place to sit & watch the people go about there daily lives while also admiring the beautifully maintained gardens. Also a great way to cut through from one area to another when you need some repsite form the traffic & crowds.

A one day sightseeing area worth visiting. One can spend almost an entire day at Ueno Park. This park is home to many museums such as the Tokyo National Museum. It also consists of many shrines and temples such as the Toshogu Shrine and the Ueno Big Buddha Temple. For a fee of 600yen (Adults) may also wish to visit Ueno Zoo. Great for families who want a restful and relaxing outing surrounded by a garden setting.

Lovely park. Lotus pond AMAZING. My first Japanese park. So interesting. The lake was covered in gigantic lotus leaves with seed pods sticking up. It must be glorious in bloom. There were walks through tall dark trees that felt a little sinister and open spaces with spreading green trees. There was a tightrope walker surrounded by a small crowd. There is a fabulous restaurant in the middle of the park and of course, all the museums. I had a great day here. It felt like a real holiday day.

Beautiful park!. Lots of room, great people- watching, beautiful landscaping and fountains, ringed by museums and an ancient temple and pagoda. This park is a one minute walk from the Ueno subway station and you could spend a week in the museums, alone. Great place!

Street performers at the park. The park was huge and clean. There were some street performers who perform magic tricks. They accept any amount of money. We brought our own food. There were benches were you can sit and eat.

Saturday visit. I would definitely recommend you visit on the weekend, we visited on a beautiful Saturday and there were so many things going on that it took us the whole day. There is a beautiful market (i assume on most saturdays) it was well worth going as we bought some beautiful hand made presents.

Must visit when in Tokyo. This park would be very worth visiting as a park, but the fact it houses the national tokyo museum, the science museum (both excellent) as well the zoo and an art gallery(which we didn't visit) make it a must visit. Allow a full day.
Large park, great place to view sakura. Large park with a huge lotus pond and 3 small temples inside. Great place to view sakura. But outside the cherry blossom season, it is just a normal big park.

Huge Park in Tokyo. This park reminded me of Central Park in New York City. Different from Central Park, it has shrines and temples. But they shared a similarity - they have zoo. This park is especially beautiful when autumn foliage is at its peak.

Beautiful park. This park would be very beautiful during the cherry blossom season! There is also a nice pond for couples to paddle a swan boat or row a normal boat. It costs about 700 yen for 30 minutes. The park is also a great place for running. I spotted numerous school children training in the sprawling gardens. The park is also surrounded by many iconic museums of Tokyo so it is most definitely worth a visit!

Loads to do!. Went here twice. I didn’t know Ueno actually has so many things until my second visit.. Tokyo National Museum (a lot of museums actually), Toshogu Shrine, many statues, zoo, etc and they’re so many things there you could do. I really enjoyed walking around Ameyoko Shopping Street there. I had a great variety of food there and I also went to their 100 yen shop. Such a good place!

Romantic and Nostalgic. I came here with my family during the winter season and we do not expect to see much. We came here just to take a walk and refresh my parents "olden days" memories.And guess what we saw?On a cold winter of December 2015 (no there was no snow), we saw some sakura trees start to bloom beautiful sakura! As an Asian from a hot country where we do not experience winter and snow or spring or autumn, being able to see sakura really delighted and surprised me! (yes although I do know that something is wrong with the climate these days but still... sakuraaaa~).I think this is a nice place for a date, a walk, a picnic yes but not during the winter of course! If you are planning for something romantic (a marriage proposal perhaps hmm?), this is a great place to do so! Remember to share some sake with me though!

Visit during summer. You will experience better colors and vibrance during summer months. There are plenty of spaces to stretch out and enjoy a little picnic, making it a great place for city dwellers. Suburbanites will probably yawn. Spoiler: the fountain is not all that it is cracked up to be.There are plenty of things to do aside from walking in the park. Museums and the nearby shopping areas will keep you busy. Lots of restaurants in the neighborhood.The park is directly opposite the Ueno station, so getting there via JR is a breeze.

A wonderful place of peace and relaxation in the heart of Tokyo. The Ueno Park in the heart of the metropolis Tokyo is a wonderful place of peace and relaxation. The abundance of Shinto and Buddhist temples and shrines make this park a very special experience. The Ueno Zoo lures to a rich and diverse range of interesting animals and attractions for younger visitors. Especially the cherry blossom season of Ueno Park is an absolute highlight for every visitor of the city of Tokyo. However, is also very heavily populated with people during the cherry blossom period of Ueno Park, as many Tokyo celebrate there their Hanami festivals.

Recommend visit. Alight at Ueno station. Very convenient. There is also zoo in this park. You can go to the nearby Ameyoko street (shopping market and food) if u have time. Entrance to the park is free. You can easily spend hours in this park.
Will definetely consider going during the cherry blossom period in 2016/2017.

Still has autumn foliage. It's Dec but there is still remnants of autumn. I have been told cherry blossoms look great here too. Very suitable for walking in cool weather. did not go to the zoo or museums but they are right in the park. JR train exit leads right to the park. Many places to eat around the JR station. Can be done in 1 hour if not entering into surrounding temples, etc.

Cultural center of Japan. For enthusiasts of Arts, Ueno Park is a must visit as it hosts multiple museums and art galleries where exhibitions take place all year around. On weekends, there are also many food stalls selling local delicacies patronized by locals. A good place to sample street foods.
Beautiful Museums, park OK. There are better parks and gardens in Tokyo, however, the museums that this park has are excellent! The park is spacious, with many facilities and attractions.

Beautiful park. It is a beautiful place to visit in Tokyo area, the park is just behind the ueno station ,if you have more time you can visit the zoo too.There are few restaurants inside the park and at the ueno station area , definitely it's a good place for families with young kids to visit .

UENO park in Tokyo. A visit to UENO park in Tokyo in April is a must. With Cherry blossom (Sakura) flowers is a pleasant place to visit. The park is full of Sakura flowers of different colours. If you visit Tokyo in April do not miss this wonderful place
A beautiful park. A beautiful park with great museums! Could spend a whole day just here. When we were there, they had a mark on which was perfect for lunch! Lots of nice food and cute trinkets.

Place to relax .... A lot of people, kids, young, mature, old people visiting this park. Some sits by the lake, simply enjoying the view. Some take boats throughout the lake. Some walking by. There is festival as well when I was there. No rush, like most part of Tokyo. Nevertheless you could see tall buildings surrounding the park.

So much more than just a park. The plan was to just walk through this park on the way to the zoo, but was pleasantly surprised by the many pretty sights - shrines, statues, tori gates, a golden temple, a museum, and a pond. There is even a Starbucks there, with plenty of outdoor seating.

Museums, trees, and Zoo, oh my!. So many wonderful museums to choose from, a great zoo, and a lovely park! I hear it is truely spectacular when the cherry blossums are out!! It is also near to great resturants, shopping, a subway stop, and a great little Irish pub!!

A Great Park!. There was so much to see in this park. There were shrines, an amusement park, a zoo, ruins/statues/relics, museum and a pagoda and an golden temple. Lot's to see and do and a must see. So much fun!

I on J-Dorama. came when autumn this last november. すごい!!!autumn leaves. yellow everywhere. my favourite colour!!!!I like this place, but my friend walk too fast (japanese people walk very fast)I said "you know, when you walk. I running" when I walk along this park, I feel like I on J-Dorama at TV. loland they have a mini version of Kiyomizudera (at Kyoto)nice place for family, and couple. or just lonely (umm.. a little creepy i think)I wanna go there again!!! I know this place is so famous and crowd when Sakura blooming for hanami. I visited when autumn, but I can make an imagination when I close my eyes under a lot of sakura strees. it must will so great!!!
Lots of Temples, Nice Walks. Spent the morning walking through Ueno park. Contemplating getting a swan paddle boat but did not in the end. Came upon 4 or 5 temples and had a good bit of exercise.

One Day in Ueno Park. We love Ueno because it's laid back which becomes a breather from a few days stay in lively Tokyo/ Shinjuku Area. It also has attractions for all ages so one can easily spend the whole day in this area. This time around aside from visiting the Tokyo Metropolitan Museum of Modern Art, we spent most of our time at the Ueno Zoo since our 4 year old kid was with us. The zoo, aside from the giant pandas, has a great & impressive selection of animals. They even had a polar bear & some other animal species we haven't even seen before. We love the elephants & their lions and my daughter really enjoyed watching the monkeys. Just outside the zoo is a small amusement park with different rides. Also in the middle of the park is a Starbucks store which was very much welcome in the cold autumn weather. This area has many museums and it will take more than one day to go thru all of them. Just spending time under the trees in the park in already a treat! We love Ueno and may spend a few days there in the future.

Beautiful and Convenient. Ueno Park is a must-visit when in Tokyo. The park complex is quite big, and there is certainly something to do or see for everyone! The park houses a variety of museums such as the Ueno Royal Museum, Western Art Museum and National Science Museum. Or course, there's the zoo as well!Even though it's the start of winter, I still managed to catch sights of kouyou (autumn colours), which was beautiful. My favourite spot of all, though, is the Toshogu shrine! In contrast to the crowds in the park, the shrine was very tranquil with only a couple of visitors when I went. The shrine itself is certainly a masterpiece! Definitely worth a visit.Ideal for a half day trip (if not visiting the museums) combined with a visit to Ueno town. The park is also super convenient and can be accessed through the 'Park Exit' of JR Ueno station.
relaxing place. where you can see several ancient architecture in a time, a relaxing place in the busy and crowded city

Ueno Park. nice park, located near the train and metro station of uneo.inside the park you can find nice routes to walk, and many things to see:zoo, shrine and many museums (nature, art, national, etc.)there are many restaurants and coffee shops at the station and near the station also located Ameyoko Shopping Street, you can find there a lot of street food and restaurants and also clothing and souvenirs shops.
Vast area. Great place for the kids to run about and there are wonderful colors of ginkgo trees during this time of the year
Amazing beauty of park. Very beautiful park , Amazing beauty, Pleasant weather make the moments very memorable, was feeling very relaxed and close to nature, definitely must visit this park also.

Nice park. Cheap place to explore ueno. We enjoyed the tram and the animals especially the panda. Walking distance to nearby train stations and very accessible to all cities. there is a lake where children will enjoy the swan boat etc
Absolutely beautiful. We really loved this area, great for families. Many museums and temples, plus zoo. Also, things for small kids too. Definitely worth a visit.

Great Park in the middle of Tokyo with many Museums to visit. Ueno Park is a pleasant park with historical points of interest and many museums within the ground. Nice walk around the lake which is full of lilies and pleasant surroundings. Many business people take time out from work to walk in the park which is a bit of fresh air in the middle of a bustling city.

Great park...ALL SEASONS!. This park is fantastic. Filled with people rain or shine. It simply shimmers...be it when it is filled with cherry blossoms and pick-nickers or reflecting the gold ginkgo leaves during an autumn rain. The National Museum is here (several museums actually) and the Zoo. Come for the Museums or just a walk...it's all good. This last trip we had some freezing rain...no matter...we still had fun! Bring a good umbrella (hopefully a transparent one so you can take it all in!) Easy to get to. Yamanote line to Ueno station.

Huge park with lots to do. This was our main point for sakuras and it did not disappoint. We were also suppose to have a picnic lunch which did not happen because it was raining , but thoroughly enjoyed walking down the lanes of the park and enjoying the crowds and the sakura
Nice park. Nice park with several temples worth visting, a large Starbucks, several museums and the Ueno Zoo, which is very nice and has lots of animals.
Best park must come.. Very good park for walking and relax. If you come in spring this park is good for see sakura,and there is beautiful stabucks.there are many museum,and zoo.

From doing boating at shinobazu pond, to temples visting and then tea-chatting at a tea house. Even when there is no lotus in the pond(summer), no sakuras (in Spring), or the leaves have not turned red in autumn, Ueno park area has so much to offer: From boating (at an expense) to watching swans/fish in the pond, to visiting temples of different gods/buddhas etc worshipped...If you are thirsty or tired, go queue for the long-queue/ long-history teahouse (韻松亭 いんしょうてい )I especially like the special pine tree at Kiyomizu Kannon Do (Temple)You are spoilt with various choice of museums, art places, science centres and the zoo all in the vicinity of Ueno park! (so please do your homework before going)I have visited to Ueno park close to 10times, spread over few years, I have not yet find it boring, there are times I strolled while appreciating free arts performance , whereas there are times I cycled...

Absolutely beautiful!. Lots of statues and monuments made this place educational as well as gorgeous. It was nice just to walk around and enjoy the weather and the surroundings here with plenty of choice of things to do around the area.

Big place many things to see. It starts from Tokyo national museum. Many museums on the way. The park gives you the beauty and the calm you need. But also crowded on weekends. A small lake close by. Consult google maps. At the end of the park under the jr railway there is a big market. Totally worth it. Go take a look.

Nice setting. Located right next to Ueno station. Ueno Zoo located inside this park. The park landscaping was nicely done, relaxing. Those who stays at Ueno area could grab coffee, breakfast at Ueno station and take morning walk at this park before going around Tokyo, as what I did. Nice place.

Beautiful Park. This is a good sized park great for walking aimlessly around looking at the sites. It contains a couple of museums, a beautiful lake and great wide walking paths. There are usually entertainers on the grounds (musicians, acrobats, etc.) and places to buy snacks and beverages.

Time for relax in ueno park. This place is nice for relaxing and play with your family. Just walking around, you can find another goodplace like zoo and museum. Sometimes you can find street musician.
A great park with lots to offer. Ueno park, a combination of a grand park speckled with a handful of galleries and museums. There is even an amusement park within this park! Lots of restaurants too!

Morning Jog. Stayed at Ueno and jog at Ueno park daily. Nice park with two distinct section, the lake and an elevated area where the university is located.
There is a Starbucks on the elevated area, food centre as well as some restaurants.
The lake area is smaller and mainly for recreational.

Plenty To See - But Nice Just To Tour Too. We had a last day in the city with not as much planned so we decided to take the subway to Ueno to check it out. We were pleasantly surprised and had a very nice day there. There is a shrine (not much to see if you've seen others) and a pagoda (5 stories but only up close if you go into the zoo). But many of the main city museums are located here of all different types. We ended up opting not to go into a museum but just walk the park. We ended up coming across a memorial to the victims of the WWII bombings in the city - quite something as an American to just stumble across. And then had lunch at a little restaurant in the park - really nice. Worth it if you have a casual day in the city.

Beautiful cherry blossoms. So crowded but worthwhile to view the beautiful cherry blossom trees. There were people everywhere walking down the lanes admiring the blossoms or sitting down in groups under the trees enjoying picnics. Glad I got to experience it.

Nice enough park. The park in itself is a nice enough place to wander around, what makes the place are the various attractions off it and if I included those then it would score a pip higher at least.In itself the park has some decent space, nice fountains, wide pathways and so on but you really come here to visit the other attractions such as the museum, zoo, temples and so on.One highlight for me was the chance to catch a local baseball game!

Very Large. The part is right outside Ueno station on the Yamanote line so it is good news for all the JR rail pass holders. The park itself is very large and extensive so expect to have some good exercise whilst walking the grounds. It is almost like an escape from that major big city Tokyo and you don't have to go far to get there. There are food stalls, street performers, seating a pond where you can take a leisurely boat ride for hire. It is all for a good relaxing day in Tokyo.
Beautiful escape in Tokyo. My wife and I enjoyed a sunny September day walking through Ueno Park, and stopping for coffee. It is a large park well worth strolling through.

always a pleasure to stroll through (3rd time there). love the musicians that busk in the park, and the atmosphere on weekends. with a art museum, ball park, zoo and shrines scattered throughout the area, this place is definitely worth a visit.personally would love to revisit during a festival.

A Beautifully Large Park... Didn't get to spend much time here but there is plenty to see and do here from restaurants to a lake, the Zoo, street performers - something for everyone..beautiful clean space in middle of Tokyo.
Nice nice before going to National Museum. Fountains, statues, gardens and area to enjoy the ambiance, be sure to enjoy the area before or after taking in the major museums of Tokyo

Nice walk, good food. Nice big park in the middle of Tokyo, easy to access by MRT. Several small shrine inside the park. Also there is small market selling asian food near the park. I can even find Indonesian spices in this market.

A lovely "Central Park"... so much to see and enjoy!. There are several museums, right in the Park, all worth a thorough visit: the Museum of Western Art (with Rodins, Manets, Monets, etc), the Asian Museum which is absolutely extraordinary, especially for its Japanese collection of such beautiful, even magnificent kimonos (including those worn in Noh Theatre performances, there is also a Museum of Arts & Crafts. The restaurant, set among the museum buildings is quite informal and excellent: we had the "Bento box" which offers a sampling of Japanese specialties.

A great park in the middle of Tokyo!. Ueno is an exceptional park - there's something for everyone: museums; temples; restaurants; zoo; coffee shop. When we visited we enjoyed free artists and performers. A great way to spend the day outdoors or indoors.

A Real Gem. The train stops across the road so you cant get lost. Once inside there are so many things to do. Several galleries, the zoo, the lake, temples of course and many restaurants. A great day out. Don't miss it.

Cherry blossom trees. Go check out the row of cherry blossom trees. I went there during fall and they weren't as spectacular as they would be in spring, but it's still worth it. All the major museums are located near the park.
Not as good as the other parks in Tokyo. If you only have time for 2-3 gardens/parks, don't waste your time here. Meiji and shinjuku gyoen are much more interesting.

Beautiful and Massive!. There are so many Sakura trees in this park. In spring time, the blossoms will be full and so beautiful like this movieyoutu.be/bdulsbt634AIf you go to Japan in Spring, can't miss here

Don't miss this!. This amazing park has almost everything: art, history, science, animals, performances at times. Easy to get to, too. If you take the Metro, just cross the street and turn right. Don't let the uphill access discourage you -- there's an elevator to the park level. But be aware: there's better food outside the park than inside.

Where Everyone Must Go. Everyone going to Tokyo must be visiting Ueno Park. It's one stop for having almost everything you need for a Japan trip - culture, food options, cherry blossoms at the right season, museums, parks, and so much more! It's a huge walk where every step has so much fun and thrill in it. Get ready to be a bit tired, but all's worth it.

What an amazing place!. This was the first place my husband and I wanted to visit on our recent trip to Japan. It's incredible, and we only saw a part of it! The museums, shrines, the lake, statues, the relaxed atmosphere, everything about this was wonderful. The day was overcast, with an occasional drop of rain, but we still spent about 6 hours enjoying as much as we could. I can't imagine visiting Tokyo without going here and trying to discover as many gems as you can! As a photographer, I was enchanted; as a student of history, I was thrilled! If we'd had children along, the zoo, I'm sure, would have been an important stop, instead we hit as many other areas as possible. One piece of warning: there is construction work going on. We found ourselves outside the part, and assumed we could go in another entrance...the next one was more than a mile away. Be careful on the outside edge of the lake! Otherwise, everything was wonderful! The park has easy access from Ueno station, which was on the JR Line so travel was free with our JR pass.

Lovely park.. This park is really pretty. Would go again. Despite the thunder and lightning we had ;-). You can't control the weather. Nice shrine with people using it throughout the day. Show respect and it is lovely.

Nice Walk. This is a very large park in Tokyo right next to the Ueno JR station. There are many museums in the park (Science, Art). I went for a walk and it was a nice, cool, fall day. There were many folks in the park so it was good for people watching. There is also a lake full of lotus plants and then one for boating (rental boats). There is a Starbucks (sadly) in the middle of the part yet the line was too long for me to consider. The biggest attraction seemed to be the Zoo. There were also a number of temples that were open to the public. There are many trees so it must be incredible during the spring tree blossom season.
Must visit. You can spend one full day in this park and still not seen everything. Museums, a zoo and nice cafe (park side cafe with very good food) is among things to do

Art, history and people watching. Whatever you do, don't miss Ueno Park with its vast stretches of green, many art galleries and museums and best of all Japanase people from all walks of life who flock here in their thousands (it sometimes seems like millions). But there are havens of quiet if you want to escape the crowds, such as the Tokyo National Museum (free entry to the over 75s) which has a magnificent collection of ukiyo-e woodblock prints and samurai armour.

Don't go on a Monday. We went to Ueno Park on a Monday and unfortunately, most museums and the zoo were closed. But we did see the beautiful cherry blossom row which we could imagine would be amazing in the spring when the blossoms are in full bloom or when the leaves turn color in a few weeks time in Tokyo. Overall, it's a very peaceful and pleasant park away from the crowds and madness of the city. Just remember not to go on a Monday. It would have been an even better experience I am sure if we were able to hit the National Museum or the Zoo.

Must visit while in Tokyo. For a westerner, this really reminded me of Central Park in NY or the mall in DC. Beautiful green space in the middle of a large urban area. Enjoyed the shrines and temple. The pond is not very scenic as it is covered with lotus plants. Bring your walking shoes and plenty of water!

Fun for everyone. Ueno park is totally diverse. Museums, street performers, a beautiful zoo, all in all a day well spent. The street performances were in 6 or so different areas. Something different each time and a schedule of everything that day to make it easy. There is a lovely carousel and lots of little shops with things like panda shaped waffles, cotton candy, popcorn and some delicious icecream. A large Starbucks too for those who need their caffeine fix.The zoo is lovely. Huge if you are from India and not so large compared to Taronga zoo etc. Enjoyable none the less. There were toddlers, teens and even my 32 year old husband enjoyed it immensely. We got lucky. It was feeding time so the animals were out in all their glory.The park is easy to get to on the JR line or even on the regular metro line. Entry to the park is free but zoo is 600 yen per adult. Totally worth it. The park is also a great place to potentially have a picnic and people watch.

A classic site for tourists. . Ueno park is very calm and relaxing, it has a bunch of shrines and pagodas all over the area, something that is important to put in consideration is that the size of the park is pretty large and you will need to walk 10-15 minutes for example from the entrance to the zoo area, so if you are planning on exploring it fully, it can take a while, but overall, a lovely place with calm atmosphere, full of tourists (at least the day we have been there)The pagodas and shrines are very recommended so make sure you do not miss them.

Great park with cherry trees and museums and small amusement park for kids and lots of Streets performers. Great park with cherry trees and museums and small amusement park for kids and lots of Streets performers.Medium size park, just behind the station.The performers level of skills is in general so low that my son of nine years plays better piano, and he has never learnt it. But it is Funny!Lots of locals on a Saturday. Very relaxed.Cafes available.
well-kept park. We really enjoyed our leisurely stroll through the park and around the pond. Autumn colours were wonderful and the award-winning Chrysanthemums on display were delightful.
Nice park with many interesting sights. Ueno Park is well worth a visit, if you do stay in Tokyo. There are many interesting views in the park - shrines, pagodas, fountains and more.

Tranquil. Visited in autumn when the leaves we're turning red and the trees in the park looked amazing, great place to relax and take break from the crowded city look at tokyos skyline through the multi coloured trees

Big and nice park for family. Good place to visit event not in cherry blossom or autumn with red leaves time. There are street music performance and some restaurants/starbuck to enjoy. Also you can see lots of pupils here.

Awesome place for Adults and children as there is so much to do. Ueno Park includes many museums, shrines, restaurants, picnic areas and a zoo. No sure about the zoo and seeing lonely animals cages in a small space but loved seeing the panda.

Amazing in Autumn Time. I was lucky enough to visit in Autumn and the trees were glowing with different colors, very enjoyable walking through the park to the national museum. Would highly recommend visiting here if your looking for a laid back experience in Tokyo.

Sunny day in the park. I went to this park with my boyfriend. It was a nice relaxing walk on a sunny day. We also visited the Royal Museum because there was an exhibition there that my boyfriend really wanted to see.

Some peace of mind in a crowded city. I have visited Tokyo 5 times now, previously stayed in Iriya, this time in Nezu. It is especially beautiful during the sakura (cherry blossom) bloom period early April, but also outside that I love to come here. Tokyo is very crowded and hectic, so a short visit to Ueno park is just what you need to find some peace of mind. With artists and a good calligrapher at the entrance, and a visit to the statue of Saigo Takemori (the real 'last Samurai') it is an interesting place to visit, with great history. If you're not staying close to here, I recommend to drop by there during a visit to Asakusa, which is not far from there.

Great Park but BEWARE of the fake MONKS. The park itself was amazing but be wary of monks who give you a WAYERCOLOR CARD of the buddha and a BEAD BRACELET. They'll aggressively ask for donations, which real monks never do. If you see them just STEER CLEAR.
National museum. loved the main museum and also the restaurant next door for lunch! Enjoyed the samurai costumes and ukiyoe woodblock prints.
Amazing!. This park is huge! There is so much to see and do or just lovely for a stroll through. There is also ueno zoo, a shrine and places to eat. Definitely visit here!
Large and lovely. Huge park. Lots to do including seeing the Tokyo national museum. Recommended for a stroll and for the various feature attractions. Peaceful, serene and attractive.

The best location during the spring to see the Cherry Blossom's. If you are there in Japan during those critical 2 week period to see the Cherry Blossoms Then this is the place to be. Even if its another time of the year this park is calming and close to Ameyoko and easy to get to by Train

Great place . Located directly opposite Ueno train/metro station and a must visit whilst in Tokyo. The park itself is very nice and well maintained and there's lots to do whilst inside - The National Museum, Museum of Nature & Science, Metropolitan Art Museum and the Ueno Zoo to name but a few. There's plenty of cafes, food stalls and vending machines towards the north end to keep you fed and watered as well. Open 5am to 11pm and I would highly recommend it.
Beautiful. Great place to stroll and having a picnic.Love the atmosphere here.Located near to the train station.This place is huge but beautiful.

Lots to see and do. Ueno park is located just past Ueno station , literally a 5 min walk away.The park is quite big, it has numerous museums, a baseball pitch, a smaller version of kiyomizu dera temple, which is in Kyoto, a boating lake, lake full of lily pads, turtles and koi carp, there is also a zoo. You can spend more than 1 day there as there is so much to do. We went to the zoo, and boating lake, where we hired a swan pedaloe but we had a lovely stroll around the park. Cheap day out- great for kidsThere is also a cafe and a little funfair for the kids.

Great Park with stunning shrines and scenery . Gorgeous park with lots of hidden pathways and shrines. There are places to eat but they are a little pricey and plenty to do with galleries, museums, ponds, zoo and shrines.

Lovey place to see on a warm day. Lovely place to see lots of history and a museum.Had a really nice day there would definetly return.Love the fact it is fight next to the station and the metro and also in the centre of town.

Experience Tokyo park life!. Not a 'review' of the park as such as we only walked through it on the way to Ueno Zoo, which is at the far end of the park. The park was quite beautiful though, laid out as a 'western style' park at the end of the 19th century but does contain a lot of Japanese elements, a small Buddhist temple, huge pond/lake as well some of Japan's most important museums! The 'Hanami' maps around the park indicate this is a popular place for cherry-blossom viewing in the Spring as well. During our short visit we witnessed a wide cross-section of Japanese society in the park, from suited salarymen to street entertainers to sake-swigging bum fights at the Shinobazu exit! Enjoy the rich tapestry of Tokyo park life!
Good place for nice walk. Great after a long flight, close to Uena Station, lots of shops and museums, also lots of lovely mature Ginko tress (and concrete!)

Two steps from the train station. I really enjoy this park early in the morning. There's few hidden place which is nice.
On weekends you can see some kids playing baseball.

dont mis the zoo. this is a huge park in tokyo, you can get there using the JR line and it is crossing the street from ueno station.there are several museums but best part is the zoo is not expensive around $8 USD and there are all kinds on animals from all over the world great please to relax in the center of tokyo

If you only had one day in Tokyo this would be tbe place to spend it. Just across the road from the Park Exit of Ueno station, this park has so much to do in all in one place.There are museums and temples, cafes and resturants, a lake with paddle boats, and lots of lovely tree lined lanes to walk along. The zoo has made improvements since I was there last, but still lags behind in the quality of some of it's enclosures. However, it provides an opportunity to see pandas, gorillas, polar bears and other interesting animals up close. On the days we visited there was also a craft market and lots of vibrant street performers. It's also located very close to Ameyoko Market Street.

Lovely large park. Lovely large park next to the railway stations. Has many shrines there and this is where the museum and zoo are. Nice place to visit to get away from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo.

Beautiful Park. A huge and one of the most beautiful park that I have been. There are shrines and temples around as well, not to mention the best looking Starbucks cafe that I had personally seen is there as well. I went on a sunny day in early Oct and it's a great day to stroll the park. Ueno zoo is right beside Starbucks but I didn't enter though. Nice place to visit when you're in Tokyo, definitely will be back to chill out again!
Something for everyone . Highly recommended to spend a whole day here. Whether you enjoy museum-hopping, the Ueno zoo or simply people-watching, there's plenty of entertainment to engage everyone.
nice park. My second favorite park in Tokyo, the park is big and has a nice pond and a small shrine. If you just have an hour, this is a good choice

A lot to do!. I had the best time in this park! We had a cute duck boat ride, we saw temples/shrine we walk through the early autumn trees, we visited the Zoo, the national museam, we had a coffee from small car, we fed the birds food ❤️ won't forget it. We visite it in the weekend, we saw a lot of kids and families, they were so nice! It is nice to see local ppl with their families

Beautiful. A beautiful park. We visited in April and the cherry blossom was out just adding to the beautiful atmosphere of the park. It's a lovely place to just potter around but there are also lots of things going on with stalls lining the streets and a small boating lake. A lovely place!

ueno park so much to do and see. Love Ueno park. Busy busy busy especially in Blossom time. great to pick a spot and just watch all the college kids enjoying a raucus time in the park, partying, laughing and daring each other with story telling etc. The park is very big and there are lots of different parts to see so take a day to check everything out and take a picnic or buy something at the station as you arrive. enjoy the lake, the templesthe blossom raining trees in spring or visit the museum or even spend a evening at the theatre.

More than just a park. Inside the park you have a long list of must visit places like the National Museum, Toshogu Shrine, couple temples etc. We went there during summer time and missed the cherry blossom.

Lots to do here!. This is a great park because it has many museums to visit and the famous Ueno zoo! You can easily spend a day here but if you want to visit every museum I would recommend allotting more time.The park itself is also very peaceful and they often have various events and shows going on. If you don't have much time in Tokyo, this can be a good choice to visit mainly because you can see a lot of Japanese culture and history in very close proximity.

Something for everyone - including a 5 year old. A large and beautiful park that is worth a stroll around. Has plenty of boards with maps to help find your way to the various attractions in the park including Ueno Zoo, the lake, an amusement park, the Museum of Western Art, the National Museum and a Science Museum. There is a Starbucks in the middle of the park – although it had a very long queue on a public holiday. The Zoo is quite interesting with pandas, aye-ayes, beautiful birds, lemurs, hedgehogs, flamingos and much more. It is quite reasonably priced at around 600 yen for adults and free for children (but closed on Mondays). There is a small children’s play area just near the main entrance to the zoo. The Museum of Western Art is another interesting stop with Rodin’s ‘The Thinker’ statue in the front garden. Entry is around 420 yen for adults and for this you can see Monet’s Waterlilies and works by Renoir, Cezanne, Degas, Manet and Picasso (to name just a few). The Museum of Western Art is usually closed on Mondays (check the website for details). There are clean toilets around the park, but take handwipes as soap may not be available.

my favorite place in Tokyo. the natural environment is excellent,meanwhile, you can visit the western art museum , the collection there is very tremendous and you can also walk to Tokyo art university.

Walk in the Park. Came to Ueno Park on the spur of the moment and glad we did. The gardens are good and there are many temples and shrines associated with the park. Also inside the park there are a number of street performers which we also enjoyed. Well worth spending s morning.

Relaxing and beautiful. A beautiful park to spend some time to chill and relax. There are quite a number of attractions in this park including zoo and shrines but we were only able to visit a few including Tokyo National Museum. Nevertheless, still enjoy the view of smaller temples/gardens. Nice spot to spend some time to relax if you are not in a hurry.

An oasis of calm - something for everyone. I kept coming back to this place. You can sit and relax with the pond (the lower part of the park) or take kids to the zoo, or just get into the main, central part where the fountain is and just watch the world go by. A very beautiful place and it needs exploring so take note of the helpful maps dotted around.My main day was a Sunday when I did all parts on my little bike. There were families and kids playing, the fountain was in full splash mode, there were a couple of brilliant lads playing fast, harmonised, glockenspiel stuff, a lady fully engossed into her Yoga, old folks walking by taking the world in...and then there is temple stuff hidden away, as well as museums and art galleries if they're your thing. Highly recommended, and if you're facing Ueno Station with that huge zebra crossing in front of you, the park area is away over to your left. You can either walk up a fairly steep path one way or take the main road round the corner and climb some steps to go in that way. In any case, just ask someone - everyone is friendly and helpful.

A great place to see the sakura. This park is so nice to walk around. It is one of the place to see those sakura in begining of April. The shrine in the park was nice and good to plan to go there for enjoying the sakura. Too bad that we were in there a little too early. Hence, we only see a few sakura blossom trees. If you want to enjoy the sakura in the Ueno park, please plan the period around 2nd or 3rd week of April.

Excercise, Fresh Air and the Shrine.. Green garden with beautiful flowers everywhere .Temples , Shrines and a Zoo in the park. Just across the street from Ueno station. fresh air and walking exercise . Good experience.

A park with it all. A big park with everything from a zoo to museums within its bounds. I am a runner so I went for a jog around the lakeside of the park. There is so much to see from the waterlilys to the swan shaped boats, that you can really enjoy the run.
Walkers, families and locals also enjoy the park.
Nice and relaxing. This is a nice park that you can sit and relax in. There's lots of space where you can watch the boats on the lake or walk through the many temples in the grounds.

Must-see :). The park is clean, beautiful, spacious, and has lots to do. It is tourist friendly and you will see people from around the world and all different backgrounds here. This place is a must-see.
Tranquility.. I was in Ueno Park in April admist the amazing blossom trees. Just lovely. It is, however, much more than just the blossoms. A haven in a busy city.

We love this Place. Great place, so much to do and to see in this park, also goof for kids. Spend 3 to 4 hours if you want to see some art exhibition.
A lot of Japanese tradition, entertainment, Panda Zoo and many things about Japanese culture. A very good place for a good walk and picture.
Must see. Lovely park with lots of options: from zoo to amusement park for kids, shrines, local artists, museum and so on.

big park with water features. This is near the Ueno train station.When we got off, a short walk brought us to the part where large water lilies were. They were amazing and a lot! A short walk further brought us to the lake or pond where one can go boat-riding. And then a long walk further brought us to a fountain area in front of the Tokyo Museum.This park is large and very clean. I believe that parts of its walkways are strewn with cherry blossom trees which could have been very beautiful if it was in bloom during our visit.

It's safe to walk around the park in the broad day light. I was walking around Ueno and there was this park, it was very safe to walk around during the broad day night but it turns into homes of the homeless after dark.

Ueno Park. Had done multiple visits to Ueno Park during my Japanese stints. During most of our visits to Tokyo, we tried to make it as a point to visit Ueno as well. Big and clean and located in walkable distance from Ueno station made us choose Ueno Park to take a break while roaming around Tokyo and nearby areas. The park is very beautiful during spring with full of cherry blossoms though there will be lot of crowds in the season. There is a zoo and a lake also present here..
夏の池. 夏になると上野公園の池の蓮が咲きます。四季折々の姿があり、とても素敵。There is 4 seasons views. When it comes to summer bloom pond of Ueno Park.It's a very nice.

A Large Park In Downtown Tokyo. If you want to get away from the tall buildings and traffic of downtown Tokyo take the Ginza Line to Ueno and explore what is a very large park which includes a zoo. It is big but not the most attractive of parks in Tokyo but it does provide an escape from the city. It also has a large lake.

A patch of green in a sea of buildings. A pleasant park complete with Zoo within walking distance of Ueno Station.
There is a market there that is worth a look, but it doesn't sell anything touristy.

You can spend the whole day here.... And not experience everything. The zoo, museums, temples, historic places are all with in 5 min of each other. While we were walking back from the science museum we came across a troupe of dancers doing traditional Japanese folk dances. We watched for quite a while and laughed when someone from the crowd joined in the dancing. Everyone was wearing very nice Kimonos and he, well he was wearing shorts and a T-shirt, but I'll give him credit, his dancing did not distract or hinder those who where dancing. Looking at the lines of cherry trees this place would be so beautiful in spring. We also enjoyed a "Saturday market" that was set up and selling just about any type of trinkets and pottery one could imagine.The Good: so much to do at this park and all with in short walking The Bad: Not enough time to do and see everything.The Ugly: Fair warning there are Mosquitoes biting unsuspecting tourists.On the scuba bubble scale of 1 to 10, I give this place 7 bubbles

Fantastic area!. Ueno is definitely an amazing area inside the huge Tokyo city, lot to see, you can spend the whole day walking and enjoying the beautiful nature, great mix of history and modern architecture, nice restaurants with open areas, I really enjoyed the peace and comfortable public areas, great for all ages!
Acrobats in the park. Walking back to hotel we came across this impromptu acrobatic performance. Thoroughly entertaining and finished off with leisurely stroll through the park.

A park, the temples the museums a zoo in one place. I can imagine the beautiful atmosphere in the blossom period... I visited in a rainy day and still I found it amazing, interesting and full of secrets: strolling around you will discover temples, a lake, museums and even a zoo. Take the time to real visit every corner and relax profiting about this unusual concentration of interesting places.Metro stop Ueno.
Sake. Great and a mixture of history and modern niceness, great fea market at the rear of the lake. Really cool

Blissful walk in the park. I came here on recommendation of a friend on a solo trip to Tokyo. The day that I chose to came had amazing weather, which I am positive added to the ambiance, but I had a wonderful time! The park was full of people strolling around and enjoying the sunny day. I walked the perimeter of the lake/boat pond that had ducks and fish swimming in it, as well as boats that looked like swans that you could rent. The Ueno Zoo within the park is also excellent. It's quite cheap and I enjoyed the giant pandas, hippo and flamingos!

Lovely park, can and did spend all day here!. We spent all day in the park, looking at temples, the zoo and museum. I got a lot of fantastic photos and thought it was a great place for a little bit of entertainment.

Visit during the weekend. You can easily spend more than few hours here. Lots of different types of street artists and people keeping you entertained. Even better if you visit the park with kids, they'll love this place

Stroll around the historic park. Next to Ueno station is this lovely park. Make a cool stroll here and enjoy a coffee, or tea, near the big fountain. Many people usually here coming for the zoo or just for walk like I did this time.
Explored a little after museum visit. Spent a brief moment exploring around this park after visiting the museum. Quite a nice, spacious part of Tokyo and definitely a good place to take a walk.

Beautiful Park with surrounding Museums & Art Galleries.. Visited this wonderful park in February,middle of Winter - weather was superb.Very popular Park but crowds were no problem as Ueno Park is massive and convenient to the National Museum of Western Art,National Museum of Nature & Science,Tokyo National Museum,Exhibitions,Temples and the Zoo.Excellent shopping & variety of food/restaurants also nearby.Well worth a visit & close to convenient transport.
Nothing special . We did not visit the place during fall. Is was a nice walk trough the park. But it's really nothing special. It was 30 minutes and we moved on to the next thing

beautiful. come to this park when the cherry blossoms are blooming, it's about late march to early april. many people doing hanami under the tree. this park is not far from the station, you can walk to go here and it's free.

Crowded parc...you can find better. My girlfriend and I had a little walk in that parc and it was really crowded by people and the parc is not as well prepared as for example the Imperial Palace gardens...We did not return and would not necessarily recommend this parc for a visit.

Nice place to see a lot in a short time. Everything is gathered in one place, and it's wonderful for tourists to be able to see a lot without having to travel a lot by metro. There are many different things to see, there's the zoo, the National Museum, the fountain, the pagoda, the Toshogu Shrine that was very nice and so on. There are guides that give you maps if you are lost, and there are normal maps as well. It's easily accessible from the Ueno JR line stop, and most of it is free. So it's a nice place to lose time without getting broke :)
Threes in the city.. Ueno Park it's amazing and it's huuuuge! Take a walk around the park and see the lake, shrines and threes with their amazing colors (even in winter).

One stop attraction. Went there when the sakura flowers has all fallen T.TStill Ueno Park is an interesting place with so many unique street performance. There are also museums, zoo, temple, and other interesting places to visit in the park
Expected a park. ... Found a couple of buildings. Even for Japanese park standards (i.e. concrete), this isn't a very nice place to chill

Beautiful wslk. We walked around Ueno Park whilst waiting for a dinner reservation at the Hard Rock which is close story Ueno station. Easy to see the park from the station. It's a lot bigger than I thought and walking around was a lot of fun. Great things to see and do. There were some food stalls when we were there near the lake and we grabbed a few little unique snacks to enjoy while walking around.

A lovely park in the midst of a very busy city. Visited the park end of March during the cherry blossom season. The whole park take in a carnival mood, with many food stalls selling local snacks, boat rides at the lake etc. Everywhere is crowded with locals and tourists busy admiring and taking photos of the cherry blossoms. Families and friends occupy every available space having picnics or just enjoying atmosphere. The park is quite large, there is a zoo, a few museums, temples and cemeteries therefore wear comfortable shoes and be prepared to spend a few hours exploring the park.

Lanterns and cherry blossoms. Possibly the best time to go is April - when the wave of cherry blossoms sweeps the country. Ueno park will be covered in millions of them. This will be complemented by hundreds of lanterns in the tree making dusk the perfect time to visit.Many locals agree and throughout Ueno park you will see groups of people putting tarps under the tree for long after-work picnics with colleagues or friends or family.I can only recommend to visit Ueno park for the evening magic of its blossoms. Come when it's still light, bring some dinner and watch the colours change. It is magnificent.

Shinobazu Pond, Ueno Park. Ueno Park is about 30 minutes from Shinjuku Station via Yamanote line. There are many attractions such as zoo, museums and pond in the area. My purpose of visit this time was to see the Lotus Garden (Shinobazu Pond). During the month of June, thd pond is full of thousands of lotus blooms.If you enjoy lotus flowers and leaves, this is one of the place to go. The pond is 10 minute walk from Ueno JR station. Go early in the morning (before 11AM), when lotus are full open and it's not so hot. Late in the day, the flowers close. Average temperature around mid-June are in upper 80's or low 90's and very humid. Carry enough water. Take your camera, with a wide and telephoto lens for complete pond view and lotus flower closeup.If you have not bedn to the Ueno zoo, visit there after the pond visit. There is no entrance fee for the pond. There is a small fed to get in the zoo.

A green oasis of culture, beauty and serenity in the heart of a megalopolis. UENO is a large public park next to Ueno Station in north-central Tokyo. Easily accessible through the most efficient metro in the world, Ueno Park is famous for the many museums found on its grounds, especially the Tokyo National Museum, the National Museum for Western Art, the Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum and the National Science Museum. It is also home to Ueno Zoo, Japan's first zoological garden. I spent a whole leisurely weekend afternoon in mid-autumn going from one museum to another. I especially liked the Samurai armor displays and the meticulously manicured gardens, where local practice nature painting classes or stroll along the ponds and fountains to relax from the busy week. Highly recommended.

Full of secret beauties. A lot to see here with beautiful wildlife and butterflies, and little temples dotted around the place. A wonderful place to walk through during the day and I imagine it reflects the different seasons wonderfully.
Beauty around every corner. You can get lost in time, walking around Ueno park. Such beauty is seen here, well worth spending the day here, close to Ueno station.

Green amidst the concrete. Scenic walk on a very hot day! Free entrance and next to the Ueno station. Highlight for us were the paddle boats in the West Garden! Hadn't done one of those in years! Good trip up here if combined with the Ameyoko Shopping Street and Zoo.

An oasis inside the caos. Nice park with a small lake covered by lotus flowers. Nice to rest and to escape from the city. There is a tomb dedicated to an ancient fifth that has been taken on the ueno park hill

Oasis in the middle of Tokyo. Nice place to chill and picnic but not during summer as it may be too hot and humid for some people. It's probably the best place for Hanami during Sakura season according to Japanese

Come with family. The best place in my opinion,bring your little children here and your whole family,they will love it. The beauty in the place is due to the public which comes here with family and friends,and tourists.This park has a calm atmosphere and as a tourist is a good place to rest.

Nice surprise in the middle of the city. This was my first time to Tokyo, so I was expecting just a massive city (which it is). The park, however, was a beautiful surprise. We had a lovely time walking through and just taking our time.

Nice Open Space. Nice open park with lots of nature and small hidden sights off to the sides. We did not have a set list of things to see, just wandered about and followed the flow of people. The "lake" portion was the best as it is more of a pond/marsh. A lot of people talk about the fountain, I felt it was overrated. We visited in AUG so can't comment on the cherry blossom experience.

Spend a day here! It's worth it!. Ueno Park was busy with Sakura viewers when we visited in April. The weather was perfect and we easily spent the entire day there. The Park is free to enter, has museums, a zoo, a small theme park and several shrines surrounding it. Wear comfortable footwear as you have to navigate several slopes and steps to see all the beautiful shrines. Entrance to the park is free, you do have to pay for the Zoo. There is a long cherry blossom pavilion to walk along and it a just beautiful in the spring. There is a smallish lake beyond the Bentendo shrine were you cnman hire peddling boats/swans to view sakuras along the bank. Really worth a visit!

Extremely beautiful Park in April!. Was there on the 2nd April at the end of a tiring city tour day. No entrance fee and I guess is always open mostly in April when the cherry trees are GORGEOUS!!!! I saw hundreds of people doing picnic sitting everywhere! Chatting, laughing, eating.....having such a great time!! There are so many cherry trees reflecting in the small pond..... Lovely!! Charts vending chips, grilled corn and another japanese treats....delicious! Located in a huge complex that includes a zoo and museums.... about 10-15 minutues north of downtown by metro ( with a specific Ueno stop...with lots of steps up by an escalator ). I left the place about 9 p.m. and it was still full of people ( they say some of them spend the whole night enjoying " Sakura"). A must visit while in Tokyo!!

A wonderful park surrounded by museums. A great place to spend an afternoon to watch the world go by! I was there in fall, so expect beautiful colors from the trees in the park. In addition to the many museums, there are a few food outlets in the park. Sometimes free street performances take place in the park too.

Lovely Park. My favorite park in Tokyo. Museums all over the place and a zoo! Check out the Panda. The art museum is free and others have cheap charges. Very close to Ueno Station. The starbucks is fave spot too. The hotel has a beer garden at the rooftop

A great retreat. Ueno Park is a gem in the middle of the urban Tokyo. It is a great place to sit and people watch. In spring it is a definite 'must go to' destination. The tradition in Japan is to celebrate the cherry blossom in April and May, and Ueno Park is ablaze with pink flowers. The local office workers celebrate the occasion by congregating in an agreed location in the park under a tree armed with blankets, picnics, karaoke machines and bottles of sake.It is worth a visit at this time of year. You might even get an invite to join in.
very pretty. A beautiful park! We went through the week and walked around looking at everything. We got a crepe from a van and drink from a vending machine and were able to sit and relax.

BIG park, with lots of great museums around it/in it Really very Nice. In August walking by the Grand Fountain is only good when the Sun is going down, otherwise its a lot of cement in the sun. People do gather around it. But there are so many museums nearby that are great to see that crossing the park is almost a must. And there are numerous restaurants near by due to the close train station that this park is great place to visit. There is good signage in the park to find your way around

Nice park to see Sakura. Managed to catch Sakura during end March and different types of Sakura were sighted here, with labels of their names on the trees. Nice weather while enjoying the walk down the park. Recommended if you want to see Sakura.

Beautiful park. A large and beautiful park where you can sit by the lake and enjoy the scenery. During the month of march, you can see the cherry blossom trees in bloom. There are boats that you can ride out in on the lake.

Ueno Park. Very nice to stroll through (our hotel was right near the park and we walked through several times when going to the National Museum, Zoo, etc). Nice wide walkways and great for people watching (esp. once it comes alive as the day marches on)

Breathtaking.. Such a beautiful park, listing to birds and cicadas in the many trees that surround the walkways. A must to visit if you are in Tokyo. Just across the road from the Ueno train station, the Ueno Zoo is inside the park area too.
Free entry.
Breathtaking views of the garden.

great during skuraseason. Been in this park twice. first time in may. last time right in the middle of the hanami event. the park is really nice when cherry trees blossoms. you also get to see how much it means of the japanese. really recommended if you can catch the hanami event. else its more a pathway to the zoo and all the museums.
Nice appartment. You will find everything you need in this clean and quiet appartment . Information upfront the arrival could be improved. We envoyer our stay!
A delightful stroll. Lovely park for a leisurely stroll but with an added bonus of the animals in the zoo. Great for kids.

Nice for a Walk. The national museum is right nearby (but requires an entrance fee) this park was lovely for a nice walk about.There weren't really artists or performers around, but perhaps this was because it was in December.

Lots to see. A must see spot for any traveller in Japan, as the park houses plenty of museums, the Ueno zoo, shrines, cafes and food/merchandise stores. The huge pond in the west of the park is completely covered in lotus plants and flowers, and quite a sight to see in summer. Although if you do visit in summer be prepared for the heat and the mosquitoes.

Nice for a walk through . We came here on a nice sunny day and it was good to get out of the city environment and into a park! I much preferred yoyogi park but Ueno park also was worth a visit. There wasn't as much going on here compared to Yoyogi that had bands playing and a market stall etc, but Ueno park was still beautiful and made for a great day taking in the sights.

Ueno Zoo and the National Museum of Nature and Science. The atmosphere of the Ueno park is very charming. There are artists performing live in the garden, acrobats...it was my first time to visit a zoo, I was so excited to see the pandas, elephants...am so impressed. Nice place to visit with family, friends or solo. There are plenty of space to rest if you are not in a hurry and much to see.There are several museum at Ueno park and I went to the National Museum of Nature and Science. It was awesome awesome awesome. There are 18 display rooms and it's so complete. If you are a biologist like myself u'll love it. I totally recommend this place.

A Gem!. A highlight of our visit to Tokyo was the time spent every day in Ueno Park. A haven from the heat with time spent under the trees through the middle of the day, a great place to eat an ice cream while watching the locals and to walk,cycle or laze the time away.The fountain display on approximately the half hour from memory is excellent both during the day and when lit at night.Seriously a great place to visit.

Lovely Park..... The garden of north Tokyo, Ueno Park its a nice and well maintain park close to the popular Ueno Station. The place its a very popular destination during the cherry blossom season or the fall with all the trees stealing the show but its such a peaceful park that has lot to offer. I stay close by from here so for me it was a nice place to visit during my mornings but unless you are in the area its not the easiest place to put in your Tokyo itinerary.
Great for a stroll.. Nice place for a afternoon / evening stroll. An hour is enough here unless one needs to visit the zoo.

Love the park. The park is really huge. Located next to Ueno station. I came last summer, the weather extremely hot, but the scenery was beautiful. There are lots of nice trees, there's zoo as well. I love the temple, there's more than 1 temple inside the park if I'm not mistaken. Will definitely come again! I bet it's magnificent on spring
Beautiful stroll to the lotus/lilly pond. So much to see here one could really stroll for hours. Must visit the lotus/lilly pond, gorgeous views.

Visit during cherry Blossom Festival. The park is quite large, with fountains, museum and zoo. Neat for a long walk but the main attraction is visiting during the cherry blossom festival also known as Sakura. You can walk through the park and there will be students seated under the blossoms playing cards, talking and drinking. Neat experience normally in the month of April.Also see Saigo-san statue (near the Southern entrance). Saigo Takamori is a very famous Samurai (check out his history). Saigo-san is with his faithful dog Tsun.
big but interesting. From beautiful trees,wide open spaces,museums,zoo,fountains,and private garden this is a really interesting place which gives u a good flavour of Japan and the Japanese people

Best seen during the Sakura festivities. Its not a place to be excited about other than when Sakura (Cherry Blossom) is in full bloom from the end of March to early May. Am amazing number of trees line the entire park and the "Hanami" (watching flowers) festival at that time is really what you want to be part of.Hanami (花見?, lit. "flower viewing") is the Japanese traditional custom of enjoying the transient beauty of flowers, flowers ("hana") in this case almost always referring to those of the cherry ("sakura") or, less frequently, plum ("ume") trees.

Huge park. Ueno park is located right next to Ueno Station and it is HUGE. You can find temples, park (of course), a fountain, a zoo, a few museums and a lot of people gathering, having a picnic, playing with the kids etc. Go here if you have one day to spent as it will take most of your time if you visit all the attractions inside. If you don't like museums and prefer to strolling in a landscape of a city, go somewhere else.

Something for everyone. We spent an entire afternoon in Ueno Park but that wasn't nearly long enough as there is so much to see.We walked from Asakusa but you can take the Metro or JR line to Ueno Station. The Park Gate exit from JR is almost directly in front of the tourist information office. Make sure you get a map so you don’t miss anything.We visited the kiyomizu kannon-do temple and Gojo-tenjin shrine before heading to the Lotus pond which was spectacular.It was a very rainy day, so we gave the zoo a miss and headed for the National Museum as cafes and coffee shops were packed. I am sure that on a sunny day, the tree-lined avenues would have been beautiful, particularly when the cherry blossom is in full bloom.We were very impressed by Ueno Park and yet only saw a small portion of it! In addition to temples and shrines it contains a number of museums along with libraries, music school and Festival hall.Make sure you visit the gigantic 30m blue whale which is tucked away next to the Museum of Science and Nature.We will certainly visit it again next time we are in Tokyo.

Strolling under the archways. Ueno Park is a fabulous place to stroll through. On one of the days there was a group of older women dressed in their traditional kimonoes, it was lovely seeing them enjoying a friendly amble through the park. We were here in summer, I would love to come back in spring to see the trees in blossom.
Great park. Inside ueno park there are Zoo and a lot of temples that worth to know !!! In the zoo there are pandas and others animals really beautiful

One of the best place in Tokyo. I've been there during the cherry blossom festival: AWESOME! There is a magic atmosphere. The zoo and other activities are inside, too. Easy to reach by JR. It's a must.

So much going on at this park on a Sunday. Just outside Ueno train station. There is so much to see in this park on a Sunday as many locals seem to visit. Within the grounds are many museums and a zoo. Has restrooms and plenty of areas were you can sit in the shade or people watch. There are also vans that sell food within the park itself. No entrance fee.When we went there on our way to an exhibition at Tokyo's National Museum, an Ice Sculpting Competition was taking place. This was amazing to watch.By the way the ice cream van just opposite the museum I mentioned has good ice cream.
